Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2017
FORM feels a lot like The Room by Fireproof Games, blown up into VR.
I finished the whole game in about 70 minutes. The puzzles are not hard, but simply the act of solving them in VR was a fun and memorable experience. The environments that surround you (along with the interactions), are mind blowing.

I look forward to what Charm Games comes out with in the future!

It's ok. The visuals are this game's main selling point. There are some cool puzzles but nothing super challenging and the whole game can be finished in one hour with absolutely no replayability, so if I wanted, I could just easily refund it, but I got it for 4€, so that would be a scumbag move. 682 produits enregistrés
0
32 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2017
WOW!!!!!!

Yes, it is short. Took me just under an hour, but I am also an obsessive puzzle game fanatic. Others may take a little longer, but I can't imagine it would take more than 1.5 to 2 hrs.

Having said that: WOW!!!!

It just kept stunning me with twisted lanscapes and machinery, like the sacred geometry of an alien mind. Puzzles felt mysteriously intuitive, despite having to do some really weird stuff to solve some of them. There was only really one puzzle that I didn't care for, but it wasn't awful or anything, just not as outlandish and creative as the others.

Sound design and score is powerful, chilling stuff, really selling the whole sacred alien revelation thing. It really felt like the trippiest moments of Contact or Close Encounters.

Lastly, great use of VR! Lots of intuitive grabbing, pullling, switching, aiming, peeking... none of this would have worked in a traditional game. It avoids locomotion problems by having puzzles evolve around you, keeping everything in roomscale reach. Some scripted teleportation occurs, but it all makes sense within the narrative.

I think this might be my favourite VR title so far this year. Honestly, my only regret is that there isn't more of it. I actually wish it ended on a cliffhanger, promising more chapters coming soon! I would buy them in a heartbeat. For now, I will be playing this through again just for the WOW factor, and will definitely be demoing to friends and family.

Big thanks to the devs, truly awesome work!
 
Racketmensch
1,005 produits enregistrés
0
16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 février 2018
Form ist ein surreales Puzzlespiel in einer wunderschönen Welt.
(Getestet mit der HTC Vive)
Unsere Aufgabe ist es, als Dr. Eli einen Obelisken zu untersuchen. Während der Untersuchung werden wir in den Obelisken gesogen und befinden uns in einer Art Traumwelt. Dieser gilt es nun zu entkommen, indem wir verschiedene Rätsel lösen.
Und das ist wirklich toll umgesetzt.
Die Rätsel selbst sind relativ einfach, aber das macht auch nicht den Reiz des Spieles aus. Es ist die Welt um uns herum, die so faszinierend und einfach nur optisch gut umgesetzt ist.
Das Bedienen der verschiedenen Elemente des Spiels läuft sehr gut, Fortbewegung ist nicht vorgesehen.
Um einen entfernteren Gegenstand zu bekommen, benutzen wir telekinetische Fähigkeiten, mit denen wir die Objekte zu uns ziehen. Hebel und andere Gerätschaften bedienen wir mit der Hand.
Das Spiel ist komplett in englischer Sprache, aber zum Lösen der Rätsel ist das kein größeres Problem. Lediglich die Story verpasst man so, ist aber zu vernachlässigen.
Ich selbst habe das Spiel in einem Rutsch durchgespielt, und war von der Welt von Form begeistert. Leider ist das Spiel mit ca 80 Minuten nicht sonderlich lang, ich hätte auch ohne Probleme weitere Stunden dort verbringen können.
Einen großen Wiederspielwert sehe ich nicht. Es gibt zwar noch einen "Bonusraum" in dem wir Musizieren können, aber das war es dann auch.
Trotzdem gebe ich eine Kaufempfehlung ab, weil das Spiel einfach unglaublich gut aussieht und intuitiv zu Handhaben ist.
Mir hat es sehr viel Spaß gemacht, die Effekte waren toll und die Rätsel, wenn auch nicht schwer, sehr interessant.

Gruß Ziffi
Ziffi´s Spieletipps als Kurator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/
 
Ziffi
559 produits enregistrés
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2018
45 minutes of gameplay to complete, so you'll have to let the game idle to get the trading cards.

PROS:
  • Good visuals and audio
  • Keeps a solid mystery going
  • Nice use of "instruments" to reveal parts of the puzzle or give clues
♥♥♥♥:
  • Only 45 minutes of gameplay
  • In some puzzles it may be overly easy to hit the wrong button and have to restart the puzzle
  • A player probably needs to be at least 10-12 years old based on average height to be able to play (see/manipulate the puzzle parts)
  • Some of the end puzzles (while I thought would get harder or at least more interesting) turned out to be essentially a game of Simon
  • Achievements popup at times that might catch your attention to the point where you miss something interesting in game
  • The shape puzzle with keylike pieces has issues matching/inserting after solving the main puzzle
  • Some overly similar game puzzles in 45 minutes still felt repetitive

Overall, I'd say if you're not a "puzzle buff" (expecting puzzles you have to really think about) or don't normally play puzzlers, this is a solid 3.6 out of 5. It you're a standard puzzle game player, you probably want to pass on this elementary/intro level puzzler.
 
Pug

Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2017
Works perfectly on the Oculus Rift.

Finished in 1.2 hours and that was me trying to be slow including watching the end credits. Add to that there's no replayability. The asking price of 19,99€ is relly really steep, but I have to say the experience was really great. If you have a lot of money then I say go for it otherwise wait for a sale.

The puzzles were very easy but satisfying. This may be a puzzle game, but that's not what you pay for. It's all about the experience of being in a surrealistic mind dimension. The atmosphere is nothing short of amazing.

It's the perfect game to introduce people to VR.

I cant really do the surreal VR sci-fi puzzle game FORM any real justice with a simple review but i can say one thing though and that is that i loved every single minute that i played it and simply cant recommend it enough. The only possible downside i really can think of is that maybe more seasoned players might find the puzzles a bit too easy but regardless of that the game was a pretty mindblowing experience and well worth a buy in my opinion. It's a bit short though and i 100% it in 1.9 hours so maybe better wait for a sale but the game is great and really shouldnt be missed out on if you own a VR headset.

Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2017
Very much a 'VR "The Room" Lite'. If you enjoy Manipulating levers and other objects to solve spatial puzzles, you'll likely enjoy FORM.

Interesting concept. Well designed (audio, visuals, and game progression).
Some of the puzzles were a bit low for me (6'2") and a literal pain in the neck to look at too long, but no there was no VR-related discomfort.

I recommend the game, though the price is steep for the length. Bought at 16.49CDN. 50 minutes to complete including the credits.
 
Tess!
2,277 produits enregistrés

12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2017
Seeing as its currently 40% off, I figured now is a good a time to put up a review of this thing.

Altho puzzley games arent usually my thing, I hadnt bought a VR game in a while (when this launched), so I took a chance with FORM. I found I was pleasantly surprised, what I remember to be most striking was how much care and effort went in to have this game so well polished.

The puzzle side of things were a bit easy, but that is a tricky thing to get right (and right for who?). I would rather slightly too easy than the opposite IMO, no frustration! The length (common VR theme!) is short. Without rushing or being a genius, I finished this in an hour or so, incl the credits. Other than the length, the game did cheap out a bit in the middle during a story clip, it was told to a static backdrop. But considering the time and effort to do things well in VR, I think it was the right decision, rather than make the game shorter (assuming it was a budget call).

If you havent played Simon, or done a jigsaw puzzle in years - like a normal person - then maybe its retro enough for you to enjoy it again, briefly.

FORM is a beautifully and lovingly crafted puzzle game. While short (about 1hr), at a discount is a worthwhile purchase.

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Hallo Leute !

FORM:
Hinter diesem unscheinbaren Begriff verbirgt sich ein außerordentlich interessantes Spiel in virtueller Realität (VR).
Nun, über VR ließe sich hier so manches sagen und wollte ich meine jüngsten Eindrücke hier auch nur in Stichpunkten wiedergeben, es würde den Rahmen des Reviews sprengen, niemand würde soviel lesen wollen, dessen bin ich mir sicher.
Daher knapp und kurz: es ist fantastisch!

Jetzt aber mal zum Spiel. Wir selbst stellen einen Wissenschaftler dar, der sich mit - ich sag mal Alientechnologie - beschäftigt und dabei zahlreichen Puzzles ausgesetzt ist. Haben wir anfangs an unserem Arbeitstisch den entscheidenen Scanvorgang abgeschlossen,
öffnet sich eine Art Lichtkugel zu einer anderen Welt.
Es baut sich eine atmosphärisch außerirdisch wirkende Umgebung auf, in der unsere Vorstellung von Physik nicht mehr gilt. Die Schwerkraft gehorcht dort ihren eigenen Gesetzen.
Die Story ist eigentlich selbsterklärend, wird aber zeitweilig von einer englischsprachigen Stimme mit einigen Hinweisen untermauert.
Viel wuchtiger kommen da aber die visuellen Eindrücke zum Vorschein. Die Umgebung erscheint riesig und ist 360° interaktiv. Der sphärische Sound vermittelt eine so räumliche Tiefe, daß ihm im Hauptmenü ein eigenes Kapitel gewidmet wurde.
Der Großteil der Aufgaben besteht nun darin, Mechaniken durch Licht und Töne wie ein Schloss zu öffnen und somit Zugang zum nächsten Puzzle zu erlangen. Man vergisst dabei buchstäblich Zeit und Raum und verliert sich in diesem Spiel.

Nun, da ja jede Münze bekanntlich zwei Seiten hat, komme ich mal kurz auf die unschönen Dinge zu sprechen:
Leider ist die Sprachausgabe nur in englisch, wer das nicht versteht, glaubt von der Story nicht viel mitbekommen zu haben.
Zweitens: Ich weiß nicht, ob das nur mir so ging, aber mehrere Male im Spiel ist mein Standpunkt verrutscht und ich konnte die Elemente nicht greifen. Da half nur Neukalibrierung und Neustart des Spiels. Ein Bug?
Ach ja, - und Punkt 3 ist die Dauer des Games. Es war mir zu kurz! Ich hätte am liebsten noch Stunden weiter gespielt, aber auf einmal war es zu Ende. Sowas von schade aber auch.

Fazit:
Ich hatte das Spiel von einem Freund geschenkt bekommen, der es besonders gut mit mir meint. Schon mal dafür danke!
Aber hätte er es mir nicht geschenkt, - dann hätte ich es mir gekauft.

👑 Powered by HoI 4 Deu Curators group in German / English 👑⠀⠀⠀
  • Follow Main group
  • Follow Second group
and discover more reviews from me
 
ROHACK
72 produits enregistrés
3
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2021
雰囲気先行型のVR簡単パズルアドベンチャー。

■概要
神秘のアーティファクトが発する信号を調べてたら精神世界に飛ばされちゃった科学者が時々家族の記憶なんかを思い出しながら、多角形がグリグリ回転しつつモーフィングする抽象的世界で知能テストみたいなパズルをやるゲーム。

……だと思うが、英語音声はあっても言語問わず字幕を表示する機能がないのでよくわからない。初回プレイでクリアまで50分。短い。VRゲーって大体そうだけど、1,480円で50分は短い。

■感想
「枝分かれした紐のそれぞれの先端に●や▲、■等のピースが付いた物がいくつかと、ピースと同じ数だけくぼみがあるので、同じ形のくぼみにピースを嵌めましょう。ただし適切な組み合わせを選ばないと紐の長さが足りません。」……とか、パズルとしては児童向けというか、なんかこう知育玩具を連想するレベル。

なので「ゲームとしての面白さ」を担う要素は、正解したらピースが光ってくぼみに吸い込まれ台座がパタパタと折り畳まれたかと思ったら箱になって開くと中からカギが、みたいなモーフィングを立体視する映像的な楽しさと、被追跡モーションコントローラを使うからまるで自分の手でピースを掴んでるような感覚で操作ができちゃうんだ、っていうVRゲーなら大体標準搭載しててなんら他より優れてる点に数えられない部分頼り。

つまり発売当時の、全体的なレベルが低かった中では頑張ってた方、という意味のメタスコア81であって、後発のVRゲーを遊んだ後に遡って遊んでみて面白いものではない。


事実、システム的に大して進歩していない後継作である↑は、
様々な賞を受賞したFORMの開発Charm Gamesが贈るトワイライト パスはバーチャルリアリティのファンタジーアドベンチャーパズルゲームです。
～～なんて言ってるけどメタスコアは60しか無い。

Twilight Path→FORMの順で同日にまとめてクリアしたが、どっちもどっちというか、FORMに81点付けるならTwilight Pathが60点は低すぎるし、Twilight Pathに60点付けるならFORMが81点は高すぎると思うので、ゲーム自体は両方とも70点、ただし発表当時の時代背景によって追い風補正と向かい風補正がかかっている、が妥当だと思う。
 
Greener
4,109 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2018
FORM was a blast.

Although it's really short, the atmosphere is extremely well done and extremely immersive. If the game had been 2 or 3 hours longer, it would have been worthy of holding a place in top 10 vr games of all time. but, sadly, it ends before it can show its full potential in immersion and storytelling.

Don't get me wrong though, the devs did a really really good job. Graphics, sound, puzzles, all well done.

The puzzles were quite creative, but not brain-destroying. Every puzzle sequence could be solved quite quickly.

As a proof of concept, this game is overkill. As a full game, the game needs juuuust a little more content.
 
Bootleg

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2017
Una experiencia para la VR increible.

Es cierto que el precio para la duración parece algo excesivo (a mi me ha durado menos de una hora, y no tenia intención de hacer un speedrun, ya que intentaba interactuar ♥♥♥ todo), pero creo que ha sido de las mejores experiencias que he probado ♥♥♥ las HTC Vive hasta el momento. En mi caso, dejé el chaperone en modo "Developer" (las menos interferencias posibles) y la inmersión, ♥♥♥ esos escenarios y el sonido es absolutamente brutal. Los puzzles son una muy buena muestra de como plantear problemas interactivos en la VR, y están muy bien resueltos aparte de las animaciones que acompañan a cada acción.

Espero que el equipo vuelva a hacer una continuación bastante más larga similar, ya que me he quedado ♥♥♥ ganas de más :)

Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2017
Sorry but have to give this a thumbs down, mainly on price and game length.

I got this in sale @£11.24 and the game lasted just over an hour for me (stopped to sip my beer a few times). I can’t even drink £11.24 worth of beer in an hour, so certainly not value for money even though…..

The graphics are truly wonderful

The sound and music fits well

There is a story, but no history or lore, so you wonder what its all about

The puzzles are interesting, with very clever mechanics, graphics and with motion controller input, but the puzzles are not very challenging

It’s standing only (no room movement required) as described (just though I would repeat this)

You probably won’t play this again, although it’s worth showing off to your friends.

If you have the cash, take the splash, if not, best let it rot

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2017
FORM这个游戏是我目前玩过的最精致的VR解谜游戏。视觉效果炫酷，音乐大气磅礴，谜题也很充分的利用了VR的优势，体验很震撼。
不过缺憾也是显而易见的，那就是游戏真的是太短了，初见1个小时就能玩通，然后就只能用来听音乐（虽然是很炫酷的音乐）。真希望开发团队能再开发些新关卡或者在他们的下一个游戏中能有很长的游戏流程和同等优秀的游戏设计。
总之，游戏确实是值得一玩的，价格上如果能打个对折或者更高的折扣完全可以考虑入手，很期待这个团队的新作品。

两个隐藏成就的达成条件：
Asking For Trouble: 在游戏要求的剧情触发之前拉十次Blast Door的那个大拉杆（左手边）
Got Back to Work: 在扫描陨石样本之前把桌子上所有能拿起来的东西都扫描一遍
 
Gene Mono,

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2021
Wow!
An amazingly beautiful experience!

I personally believe that VR (at least as it is today) is not very well suited for hard-core gaming.
But is amazing for having VR experiences.
Be it watching movies on huge virtual screens, visiting amazing worlds location, or playing with things with your hands.
I wouldn't play Civilization or Cyberpunk in VR, but would definitely play some laser tag or ping pong.
(it reminds me of the Wii console in that sense)

And this game hits the formula perfectly!
The game is very well made - you're not told what to do, but you intuitively understand within a minute what you're supposed to do.
The soundtrack is excellent.
The graphics and atmosphere are amazing.
Really a perfect way to experience VR.

I will acknowledge that the game is indeed on the short side.
Looking at people's reviews - looks like everyone finished it in slightly over an hour.
Now I'm not sure if it's worth the full $15 price.
On the one hand compared to other Steam games, it seems a bit high. On the other hand, compared to VR games (that usually cost $20-$30) it's not that high.
But we have the advantage of Steam.

How much would I say the game is worth?
So I was able to buy it for %70 off, and I think it was totally worth the money.
I definitely do not expect it to be free - by the level of content and polish you're getting.
But anything below $10 I think is a fair price.
 
Mdk25
744 produits enregistrés

+ Fun (if simple) puzzles with lots of physical manipulation.
+ Gorgeous, immersive environment.
+ Wonderful soundtrack, AMAZING sound design.

- Over too soon. I would have loved to see a grand finale that somehow combined the puzzle mechanics from the previous sections.

The only thing I didn't like was when it ended.

Make more games for VR, I am begging you.

Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2017
In einem Rutsch durchgespielt! Allerdings gibt es, trotz des sehr gutem Puzzlespiel, keinen Grund es nochmals zu spielen. Es sei denn man schaut anderen zu. Der Preis liegt mit knapp 20€ für mich etwas zu hoch, falls es das Spiel im Angebot für bis zu 15€ gibt, kann man es als Puzzleliebhaber unbedenklich kaufen. Ich habe es für ca. 12€ gekauft.

Das Spiel ist komplett auf englisch, aber das stört bei den Puzzlen gar nicht. Nur die kleine Story ist dann denn nicht Englisch sprechenden nicht verständlich, obwohl hier die Ansprüche nicht so hoch sind.

Die Grafik ist erstaunlich. Es gibt detailreiche Mechanismen zu bestaunen und benutzen und das alles in einer surrealistischen Atmoshäre. Die Puzzle sind nicht so schwer und eher intuitiv zu lösen, sodaß kein Frust entsteht.

2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2017
Une bonne expérience, visuellement très prenante et très propre, les animations sont présente à chaque actions et on se laisse facilement s'arrêter 2min à profiter du décors.
Avec quelques passages à faire des "waouh ça en jette grave !".
Mais la durée du jeu est d'à peine une heure pour 15€ (voir 20€ à l'origine), ça fait chère l'expérience. Acheter le dès qu'il est en promotion dans les 5/8€ (ça revienne à une place de cinéma ;) ).

Les plus :
+ beaux
+ immersif
+ des éléments bien penser (comme les bulles de pensées)
+ on en veut plus

Les moins :
- trop court
- les énigmes même si elle ne se répète pas, sont trop simple (au final l'énigme reviens juste à comprendre ce que le jeu nous demande de faire)
- histoire anecdotique
- trop chère (on comprends qu'il a fallut un bon budget pour le réaliser, mais pour une telle durée et faible rejouabilité...)
 
lieo
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Wow! Such a beautiful puzzle game that nails roomscale VR. You operate massive hyper-detailed machinery that transforms right in front of you. The puzzles are somewhat abstract, but do a great job teaching you wordlessly as they react. For example if there's an object that needs to go in a socket, the socket will be reaching out to the object as you move it closers. The audio is also excellent, with each tiny detail scrubbing through satisfying clicks and clacks as you twist things in to place.

There's a tiny story that holds it together. It's well voice and has a nice mix of humor and drama, but it's sets the stage for all the abstract stuff at least existing relative to Earth. Mostly it's like Out of this World or Contact or The Room where you're the scientist transported to another dimension.

My biggest complaint is that some areas of the game frequently drop frames. If the framerate issues can be addressed this might be my favorite VR puzzle game, but till then I'll put it easily in my top 5.
 
PersonGuy

Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2019
Gameplay
■■■■■■■■.. 8/10
Grafico
■■■■■■■■.. 8/10
Ambiente
■■■■■■■■.. 8/10
Duração do Jogo
■■■....... 3/10


Espeficiações do VR:
Imersão
■■■■■■■■.. 8/10
Física do Jogo
■■■■■..... 5/10
Risco de enjoo
■■........ 2/10

O jogo conta uma historia bem legal e muito interessante. Em varios momentos é bem legal você olhar em volta e apreciar um pouco a beleza do jogo. Sem falar que ele tem uma qualidade de ambientação muito boa. Acho que o jogo poderia ser mais claro em alguns momentos para mostrar as portas e fazer com que você entenda melhor.

O jogo no final te dar uma sensação de controle ao pedir para que escolha o que vai acontecer depois e isso é bem legal. Mas infelizmente eu achei o jogo bem curto, com poucas horas você termina o jogo. Acho que poderia ter mais puzzles pois esse é um jogo totalmente dedicado a isso. E no geral eles não são tão dificeis.

Musica e visual sincronizados ao jogo são muito bons!

Caso você queira ver minha jornada neste jogo você pode ver na minha página: https://www.fb.com/scoep.net/

Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2017
TLDR: +looks great +transfers you to really different place +all unique puzles +kinda trippy experince
-lenght ~+-hand alignment

Ok, it was short. But I have to admit, it was some quality time. It's good that there was few warning reviews about shortness.

This game has many great ideas that would be great to see in other games aswell. Loved the looking sphere idea. Great movement (what little there was) from one spot to another with those light trails. Just the right amoung of surreal scenery.

Something that doen't get used enough in vr (what I've seen) is 2d - 3d portal use. That some mere flat door frame holds whole scenery behind it. Actuallu that could have been used more here too.

I see it would've been easy to extend this game by repeating same type of puzles over and over. Now it felt more unique without and unnecessary grinding. Once one problem was solved there wasnt any need to repeat same thing all over in different form.

Something that broke some of the experiance was hand alignment. It felt strange to grab and operate with palms and not with fingertips. Though I got high hopes if this gets knuckles update some day. Had couple small tracking losts but nothing that breaks the game. Just annoying reminder that reality still exists outside.

This works great as a sequel to gallery: the call of the starseed. Couple tweaks plot wise and woul've fooled me.

Still, awesome experience
 
Jon
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2021
STUNNINGLY BEAUTIFUL, WOEFULLY SHORT

THE GOOD
The visuals are absolutely stunning, the soundscape felt enveloping and aided the strange factor exceptionally well. The puzzle mechanics all had a very good feel to it, the interaction was smooth.

THE BAD
Way too short. Despite the savegame saying 'Prologue 1-1' suggesting there was more to it, there is really only 2 short stages. It takes about 70 to 80 minutes to fully explore the entire experience. The story felt shallow and unnecessary.

CONCLUSION
The gorgeous visuals and deep soundscape immediately drew me into a strange world of shapes. The story feels like it got ladled in after the fact. The strangeness and beauty was enough to tease my curiosity in solving the simple puzzles.

While truly captivating to experience, it lacks in longevity and challenge.
Wait for it to go on sale, then its worth it.
 
Sokonomi

Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2020
O jogo é bom, com puzzles interessantes (muito fáceis, até) e gráficos bonitos. Por ser ligeiramente antigo (ou quase um idoso no tempo de vida do VR), o jogo é mal polido pra hoje em dia, você consegue notar a idade do jogo enquanto joga, mas isso não estraga a imersão.

O ponto mais decepcionante, no entanto, é a duração. Pra vocês terem ideia, quando começou a aparecer os créditos, eu achei que eu tinha acabado o tutorial das mecânicas básicas e que dali o jogo realmente começaria. Pobre ilusão, o jogo realmente havia acabado. São apenas uma hora de jogo. Mas convenhamos, pelo preço, é uma experiência legal.

Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2017
The story in this game was a little vague, but I really enjoyed how the puzzles made me feel as if I were really manipulating machinery. They weren't especially difficult, but some did take me a few tries to figure out what I was supposed to be doing.

And, there was one audio-related puzzle (before the SIMON one) where I just stumbled upon the answer through trial and error without knowing exactly what I did, so I think I missed whatever guidance they were giving me.

Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, though like most VR games, a bit on the short side. Here's hoping that Charm Games makes more of these games, perhaps with adjustable difficulty to encourage more playthroughs if it is too much work to create more puzzles.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2018
What a beautiful game! I just started, looked around a little bit and I guess I completed the first "level", or maybe the second. It's a really nice flow from one experience / puzzle to the next, so it's kind of hard to say. So far, it was a little challenging here and there but after playing around for a little while, I could solve everything (one kind of seemed like luck, though ;-) ).

It's half past midnight here, so I had to stop - but I am very much looking forward to continuing this mystic, beautiful journey into whatever it is that I am puzzling myself into. A game to return to :-)

EDIT: So, I have just finished Form yesterday, and it is indeed a fairly short experience (I have 1.3 hours playtime, and I did also "play around" a little). I still think it's a great game totally worth its money. Even if you can probably finish the game within an hour if you hurry, there's a great variety of different kinds of puzzles that work really really well in VR with motion tracked controllers (i.e. for using your hands), it's visually stunning, great audio and consequently immerses you in a great atmosphere. It's basically entering and becoming part of a little fantasy movie. The trailer gives you a really good idea of what to expect.

I can probably play this game one or two more times and still enjoy it before it gets boring - but might then still be able to return to it later (like with a good movie). There were two puzzles in the game that I didn't quite "get" but still was able to complete them before it got frustrating but YMMV.

So, if you expect the game to last many hours - you probably should not buy this. But if you think about it vs. going to the movies (approximately the same price and time spent), and appreciate a high level of polishing, this game is probably for you like it is for me :-)
 
jashan

0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2019
I don't normally write reviews but a week after completing I still feel strongly enough to share my opinion. FORM is one of the best VR puzzle games I've played. Unique puzzles, visually stunning, and an otherworldly atmosphere.

I especially love how Charm Games takes full advantage of 3D space: I've played some VR games where objects are mostly just basic shapes, but FORM is not like that at all... every object that you can see or interact with has a level of detail and depth (like literal 3D complexity) that many games don't bother putting time into.

As a puzzle fan, I didn't find FORM's puzzles challenging, but they were definitely unique and something you could really only experience in VR. While the time to beat is short (~1.2 for my run), if you think about it in terms of movie ticket pricing, then it is well worth it in my opinion (and more enjoyable than any movie), especially on sale. FORM would also make a great first experience for anyone new to VR: there is no movement other than within your personal space, but FORM takes advantage of everything VR has to offer.
 
NovaKevin
1,097 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2020
I'll go through the good points first since it's few and far between; it's a fun, short little VR visual experience that has some puzzles sprinkled within. Though they're less of a challenge and more of a neat little interactive set piece. Even with low settings and a tiny play area it was enjoyable to play.

Now onto why I wouldn't recommend it; I bought this on sale for $7.52AUD since it was cheap, and I think at that price it may be worth buying. However, at full price this "game" is extremely short (it took me around 40 minutes and I was taking my time to look around the admittedly very pretty environments). The puzzles are lacking and some seemed a bit repetitive. The voice acting reminded me of the early PS2 era or a badly dubbed Japanese visual novel. Even with a reasonably powerful PC (one that can run Half-Life: Alyx with no issue) it was extremely laggy on all but the lowest graphics setting, which are all presets with no advanced fiddling of individual settings. The narrative while easy to follow, was not unique in any way and felt like a second thought added to pad between the puzzles.

Overall a mediocre game, but a fun VR experience. Would not recommend at full price.
 
Princess

- 聲光效果不錯，機關氣勢磅礡

缺點:
- 機關都太簡單太直覺，沒真正動什麼腦，當初看評論期待可以好好動腦解謎，但這遊戲注重聲光效果大於謎題深度，玩完只有"啊?就這樣?"的感覺。從頭到尾沒有卡住過，也不會想再玩一次。機關內容應該蠻適合小朋友，但機關高度又不適合小朋友...

DrPepper
623 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
Exceptional! This is a beautiful game, with amazing sound design. I was really caught off guard and wasn't expecting something as polished as this is. Right from the beginning, I knew the developers were not hacks. I was a little confused as to what was going on and what I was supposed to do, but once I got through the intro bit, it's clear as day. Everything before me was a puzzle, and they are unique. A lot of puzzle games have one mechanic that just becomes more complicated as time progresses. This is not the case wih FORM. I will say that the puzzles aren't that hard, but being completely stumped for an hour on one puzzle in VR is not an ideal experience, so I was happy to progress without pulling all of my hair out.

I completed the game in about an hour, and I am sure lots of people will complain that it is too short for the purchase price. Everyone has their own threshold for what they can pay, but in my eyes, the $15 was well worth it. This is by far one of the best puzzle games available in VR.

One final note, the video trailer for this game just doesn't do it justice. In fact, there is no way for a trailer to help you understand what you will experiece. You will just have to jump in.

It is a solid VR experience that will WOW you and your friends.
 
sterlingy
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2020
It was on sale. So I bought it.
I don't think I understood the story really.
People said they liked the visuals, maybe that was before newer VR games. They don't really hold up in 2020 compared to say, idk, Half Life: Alyx?
Puzzles were ok, definitely feels like a 2017 VR timeframe game.
$4 still feels acceptable.
Would probably have been better for a first-timer VR than someone who has played a lot of VR, more of an experience.
It's not bad thought, so I'll give it a very tentative thumbs up.

0
Non recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2022
I do not recommend FORM (as a video game)

FORM is beautiful, it has great visuals, fluid animations a dope soundtrack and puzzles that would insult the intelligence of a 3-year-old child.
This is mainly an audiovisual experience where you need to complete annoying little tasks for the next pretty thing to happen. The whole thing is under an hour long. If you are new to VR this could be a good first experience but if you are looking for a puzzle game, or a video game in general, you will probably be disappointed. In any case, I would not buy unless it is on a heavy discount.

For a short video review see:
Vidéo YouTube™: VR Review: FORM. A short audiovisual experience / puzzle game 
Vues : 66
FORM VR works as an audiovisual experience. As a puzzle game it is way too easy. The game is available on PCVR and PSVR.

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2018
Form is what VR should be all about: great looking, highly produced games and experiences full of ideas, surprises and varied interactions. Form is brief but beautiful. It left me with a smile on my face when the credit rolled and took me just under an hour and a half to finish. At £10.99 it's a little cheaper than seeing a film, for a similar length, so I'd suggest it's acceptably priced. And if it's on sale you really should grab it.

(I played with the Oculus Rift. I have a front facing setup and limited space to my left and right, but I was fine with Form. There was one point very early on where I had to reach out to the right and I hit a wall and couldn't grab an important object. I reconfigured Steam VR so that my standing spot was a little further left, and I had no issues after that. I stood in one spot for most of the game, mostly reaching forward and occasionally taking a small step forward too. There is no locomotion in the game)
 
Quartermoon
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2019
This isn't what I expected. Sure, the reviews told me it would be short, but I expected at least some semblance of a story. Instead, there was nothing. No explanations for anything. We don't learn anything about the main character except that he's a scientist and that he's married. We don't learn what this artefact is, where it came from, or why only the main character reacted positively to it. We don't learn anything substantial about the characters or their personality.

The puzzles are all very simple, and highly repetitive, which for such a short game is unforgivable. There was no real difficulty progression. At most you got to do a slightly longer version of an earlier puzzle, but never something that turned an existing concept on its head and made you think about it in a different way. Just repetition of the same kinds of puzzles, which were mostly a chore to do.

It's very pretty. The environments look very cool in VR. That's acceptable for a short tech demo, or a room in Steam VR, but not for something that calls itself a game in my opinion.

Maybe if this is your first VR experience, it would impress more. But having played something like Obduction, which is a full, many-hour long VR puzzle game with vast, beautiful environments to explore, a complex and interesting story, and mind-bending puzzles, this just refused to grab me. I didn't need it to be as complex as Obduction, especially since I knew it was going to be short. But I expected... something. Something more than flashy lights and haunting music.

If all you want is nice visuals and sound, with minimally functional gameplay to fill a spare hour, get this game when it's heavily discounted. Otherwise, I can't recommend this.
 
Dilandau3000

Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2021
First off, don't pay full price, get it for 5 bucks or less. $9.99 would be a better listing price.

The game is quite beautiful, but I was stoned while solving the puzzles and still managed to finish it in under an hour, with a like 5 minutes wasted trying to find my soda. Its upsettingly noticably short. A ton of fun for a VR puzzle game, but its so short it might as well be summed up as a demonstration of the capability of the developer. If I paid full price, and not less than 5 bucks, I would return it. I got it on sale and had top return to the store page to check the listing price to write this review. I do not believe its worth full price, but it is quite the enjoyable experience.

I would compare this to the free to play VR game Flush. The differences being puzzles, instead of skills. And a notch better graphics. BTW the main graphics element of this game is absolutely the lighting system, that's the focus.

Autism Attack
190 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 aout 2019
FORM is a beautiful, meditative sci-fi puzzle game with outstanding aesthetics and emotional weight. If Tarkovsky's ghost were to follow up "Stalker" and "Solaris" with a video game instead of another film, FORM might be that game.


The Good:

1. Art -- Simply put, FORM is visually a knockout. Rich metallic and jewel tones glow amid deep shadow like the sunless void of space. Skillful use of light, darkness, and grand scale masterfully create an atmosphere of cosmic mystery.

2. Sound -- The environmental sound and especially the music are every bit as beautiful as the visuals, reaching a peak during a certain musical puzzle late in the game that moved me to tears. (Fortunately that puzzle has you looking up and out into the distance -- face gaskets dry without damage, lenses would be a different story...) I strongly recommend you use a good set of earbuds or headphones with this game.

3. Puzzles -- The puzzles are overall an enjoyable difficulty. They need enough thought to not feel childish, but they're not so difficult to become frustrating or bog down the pacing of the game.

4. Performance -- FORM ran smoothly with max settings on the Index at 120hz.


The Bad:

1. Length -- FORM is short, very short. I finished it in one sitting of about an hour, and took my time to enjoy the beauty of the setting. On the other hand, given the focused nature of the puzzle types, I think much longer than an hour and a half probably would've ended up feeling repetitive. I would've enjoyed it if each group of puzzles would've been drawn from a pool of different configurations for their type, so that the exact solutions would be different on each playthrough.


The Ugly:

Nothing, really! FORM's an exceptionally polished experience, and I ran into no bugs or weird pain points in the puzzles or gameplay.


Nerd Stuff:

My first run through FORM was played on the Valve Index with the Index controllers. I didn't run into any compatibility issues with FORM, which was released well before that platform was launched. Even the in-game hands automatically aligned properly with the Index controllers without my having to make any manual tweaks, which was a pleasant surprise.

FORM makes heavy use of deep darkness in its visual design. If you're an Index or other LCD-based headset owner who has the luxury of also having access to an OLED-based headset like a Vive Pro or a Samsung Odyssey, you may prefer to play FORM on the OLED headset, to take advantage of the true black they can render. The Index did an acceptable job rendering the darkest of scenes, but the elevated black levels were noticeable. Less extremely dark scenes were pretty good.

The original Rift and Vive are OLED based, but their low resolution would be too steep a price to pay IMO -- the art in this game is quite detailed, and it would be a shame to be unable to enjoy that.

I'll update this section later with an informed comparison when I replay this on my Vive Pro.


Final Thoughts:

FORM is an intensely beautiful, if brief, experience. It's an instant buy on sale, and even if it's not, I'd still say it's worth it.
 
Silex

Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2017
FORM is a game with fairly simple and smart puzzles to solve in a very beautiful surreal environment. This is a game to play when you want people to understand the kind of games VR enables. Priced very fairly, by the time you finish the relatively short game you are left wishing it was a longer game. I personally look forward to seeing a DLC adding stories or puzzles to this, or a future sequel. This game is highly recommended for those who are new to VR looking for a puzzle game that they can sit in and enjoy the world.

2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2020
***Recommendation only made when on sale***
**PLAYED ON OCULUS RIFT S**

I feel bad not recommending this game at full price but here in Australia this game sits at $21.50 AUD. For a short puzzle experience, with an under developed story which barely scratches the surface. I cannot recommend anyone paying for this at full price. However on special, it is deserving of recommendation.

I purchased this on sale during the recent Christmas sale, and I enjoyed my time approaching the puzzles. Puzzles in VR are always just that bit extra. The level of detail to Form makes this an audio visual experience, more than an actual puzzle game. For VR newcomers, this may be a title I show them.

1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2017
This game proves, to me, that VR can work long-term. This is the sort of game VR works best with in my opinion; slow, methodical, MYST-like puzzles. FORM is absolutely breathtakingly beautiful, with awe-inspiring alien landscapes and formidable music. The puzzles are a good mix of linear-self-explanatory, exploration-puzzling and trial-and-error.

The one problem is that this game is way, way too short. I was definitely left wanting; I'd like a game like this but with 20, 50 or 100 hours of gameplay.

As it is, this game is simply a testament to what can be done. See it as a demo. Of the future.
 
krank23
1,496 produits enregistrés
0

Beautiful experience. Exactly what I was looking for when I bought my VIVE. Downsides are the game is fairly short, the puzzles are simple, and there's not much plot.

Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2017
Short(~60 minutes if being generous) but immersive VR game, very reminiscent of early PC puzzlers in terms of potency of the experience. It gets a lot out of the spatial puzzle gimmick and doesn't overstay its welcome.

Some of those puzzles can be tripped up or made a bit more difficult by how your VR room is setup, but it works incredibly well overall and makes great use of the medium.

Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
I was initially reluctant for the 15 eur / hour but got conviced by some folks.

I dont regret this trip. I really was inside hyper-space manipulating alien technology. So cool.

It is an easy experience. You can't get bored and stop the game to come back later.
You never get stuck and it's a good point, because you can have the full blast in one shot.

Is it worth the money ? I am not sure, but I am happy to reward the awsome job made by this creative small team and encourage them for future development in VR.

0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2019
Produit remboursé

It's a really well done art game, such that I feel really bad that I can't recommend it. I've never seen anything like this before, and its atmosphere is so unique and realized. But it's just a tech demo. Which is a phase VR games really need to grow out of. But for what it's worth, the way the game puts you into the shoes of a genius scientist discovering some unknown power of the cosmos is maybe only seconded by the introduction of Half Life. It's just a shame that such a fascinating journey left me wanting so much more. Gameplay wise, it really goes no where and thats such a shame.

Shape matching puzzles turn a geometry themed pleasure into a preschool chore. The climax of the game is Simon Says. But I can't undersell it; before you understand that the game is only an hour long, they do a fantastic job of turning such nonsensical busy work into epic light shows and geometric marvels that put the Lament Configuration to shame. And don't get it twisted, the game is absolutely beautiful. The visuals gave me chills. But it's still a $15 dollar game (at time of writing) that lasted the length of a lunch break. I got it for cheaper in a bundle and I STILL feel I wasn't charged fairly. And at the end of the day, I didn't go out of my way to get a VR headset to play Simon Says. You can dress it up all you want with fantastic sound design and spine chilling visuals, but you still charged me a steak dinner to play Simon Says with a plastic box taped to my face. Which just makes me feel stupid.

Also the controls are kind of wonky. Your character's hand only grabs things in their palm, like they're grasping it in their hand. But you handle a lot of floaty little objects that are roughly the same size and shape as breakfast cereal pieces, so often times, I grabbed the wrong thing. They could have implemented a better way to know what you're grabbing. And of course, the ending is so abrupt, that I reloaded my save just to make sure I was seeing that right.

No matter it's merits, this visual experience doesn't even match the price point of a blockbuster movie. And for a video game, that's a pretty bad sell. But the ideas are there, no doubt. I look forward to seeing a full game from these guys some day. I hope they can take what they've learned and turn it into a full experience. But for now, this game just got me excited for nothing.

If you've got some extra money burning a hole in your pocket though, try it out. But be warned, you might be disappointed. Its ferocity does not make up for its brevity.
 
SassyTabasco
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2021
tl;dr: Not for $15.

For one thing, I finished this in about an hour. For more than the cost of a movie ticket, I'd generally expect at least a movie-length amount of entertainment or something especially novel. For a VR game that only utilizes grabbing, has maybe 2 interesting puzzles (interesting, NOT challenging), and lasts less than an hour and a half, the price point is too high.

I also think it's kind of strange that the whole game is played without locomotion, but the objects are too high and sometimes too close for you to play seated. If there's no movement required, I kinda want to get comfy. It might have been better if we could use one of the (completely unused) joysticks to move our character up and down, but that still wouldn't solve some of the puzzle elements coming close enough to poke through your body.

The story wasn't anything to write home about either. It almost feels like I watched the first quarter of a movie without ever getting to see the rest. There's some set up to start a story from, but it never goes anywhere. It doesn't really have anything mysterious enough to leave you guessing either, and it feels like that's kinda what the story is going for. Maybe it would have felt more mysterious if the "mystery" wasn't literally the thing from A Space Odyssey with a malicious/condescending personality, or if... you know... that went somewhere. It's not really a plot twist when you're told very directly that everyone that comes into contact with the obelisk is adversely affected by it, and the ending is that you're adversely affected so while the character was acting all surprised, I was just like "but you knew that..."
 
FluffyJadey

I got it on sale at 3,34 euro's and that's a very good price, the current 12,49 euros' is too much for me (but I'm a cheapass, so most games above 5 euro's I consider too expensive and yet I have a very large VR collection).
I definitely can recommend this game to many

Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
This experience what VR is all about: taking you somewhere else and make it memorable.
Sure it's around 70mn long, but at least you can do it in one go and you'll definitely want other people to experience it.

Good use of 3D audio (which is rare), performance on a 980ti is saved by reprojection, but as it is pretty much a "standing in place" experience this was not an issue or experience breaking.

Never heard of Charm Games before, but they are definitely on my watch list now.
Go buy it so they can make more!
 
OlivierJT
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2019
"At the end of my journey, I can see through time. The intricacies of space, blinded by tears. At this crossroads, I choose to lose my sanity to the cosmic beyond".

Truly a remarkable game. Very short...BUT a clear masterpiece. I would never even dream of refunding a game like this. The puzzles aren't altogether difficult. Only one had me stumped for awhile toward the beginning.

You play a scientist researching a monolith that his company has discovered. By the end, you will either lose your sanity, or be whisked away to a cosmic beyond. No spoilers.

The music, the visuals, and the storytelling....MY GOD top notch. By the end, by back was hurting from standing up but...I stuck through it, I felt like I was the scientist. I just HAD to discover the secret of the monolith. By the end, i'm not going to lie, i was teary eyed just by the visuals the music. It reminded me of close encounters of the third kind. Theh last scene where you are matching colors and sounds with the object to progress and communicate.

Again...I can't stress this enough, buy this game. Buy it at full price or on sale. The 2 hours you get out of it will be truly remarkable.
 
Bonafide Dickfart
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
This is an interesting little VR puzzle game. There is so much room for growth in the VR puzzle genre and I feel like this is more of a proof of concept, rather than a full game. The game took me an hour to complete. The story was not really memorable and the story moments felt more like filler and didn't drive the story forward. There are 3 distinct chapters within the story and some of the trippy moments are cool to look at in VR, though make little sense within the story. The puzzles are pretty intuitive and not too challenging. With the concepts introduced, there is far more room to expand the puzzles and make more challenging puzzles, which is why I say this feels more like a proof of concept. I paid around $5 for this game and I can't recommend paying more money than that. Definitely buy on sale.

Reviewed on:
Valve Index
RTX 2070 SUPER
Intel i9-9900k
64 GB RAM

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2018
A great little game. The graphical effects are astonishing and for fans of mechanical constructions doubly so. Sadly the puzzles are a bit too easy and it took me like 45 minutes or so and the game was finished. I hope it gets more content.

Runs well on a GTX 1060 and Windows with 200 % Supersampling and GPU Smoothing from the SteamVR beta. Then the graphics become really sharp.

Runs out of the box on Linux with Steam Play (nvidia 396.54.09, Proton-16.4 beta), sadly only at 100% SSA for me cause GPU Smoothing is not implemented in Linux yet and for more SSA plus the extra layer of DXVK, I'ld need a better graphics card

0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2021
This is a well made puzzle game that's pretty detailed and slightly reminiscent of 'The Room' games. The problem is, it's incredibly short. I was absolutely convinced I was at the start of chapter two of the game when the credits started rolling. A complete play through will take only about an hour, which is ridiculous for a $15 game.

I'm convinced there was a lot more planned, as the credits even mention a 'screenplay' even though there's a total of maybe 20-30 lines of dialogue in the entire game. The achievements even mention "the first dream sequence" as if there were more than one.

Anyway, if you're curious, wait for it to go on sale below $5.

1,168 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2017
I really want to like this game. The graphics and sound are mighty impressive, and you can tell that a lot of effort went into making it. If you can take the last bits of 2001: A Space Oddyssey and flesh it out, or view some of the more brilliant examples of the Demoscene (espcially ASD), that's basically the atmosphere of FORM.

But as for the gameplay and story, I was left wanting. I'm guessing it's mostly the lack of exploration; there's no movement in the game except for popping between set pieces after accomplishing a series of easy puzzles. This lack of exploraiton and lack of challenge felt... childish? Literally square peg goes into square hole, play 4-color Simon, that sort of thing. For as mind-bending graphics as the game has, I came in expecting something puzzles more non-euclidian like Antichamber, or something as challenging / exploratory as Talos Principle-- both games that a recent Reddit thread linked the game to. Sadly FORM does not live up to those for gameplay.
 
[a2m]Androktasie

Recommandé
21.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2020
Form is a fun and engaging puzzler. The puzzles are not complicated and none were stumpers. The audio is excellent and really added to the entire experience. The tracking on my Rift was dead on and I did not find any drift or feel any control lacking. My one and only complaint is the length of the game, It is pretty short. I got the game on sale and was very happy with my purchase. I hope to see many more games like this in the future. Also, dont let my total hours in game fool you. I had left it on overnight so there was actually about 90 minutes of game play.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2020
The Room in space! Well maybe that is a bit too far, but this is a fun little puzzler with a bit of a spacey/psychedelic/quantum science flair. The puzzles are pretty easy and all take place in a single location, in that you do not have to go to another room to gather parts then return. The whole puzzle is sitting right in front of you at any given location. It is simple and short but the production is very nicely done. The main game took me about 45 minutes to play through so full price might be a bit of an ask. But, grab it on sale and it is an enjoyable and well made experience.
 
Tattoo Dude

0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2020
Not too bad. The visuals are really cool but the puzzles are fairly rudimentary; put square thing into square hole, press the correct sequence of buttons, play tones in the right order, etc. It took less than an hour to beat but it was starting to get repetitive by then so it's about the right length.

Overall I'd recommend it if you can get it on sale and you don't expect a long game going into it.

Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2020
wasn't expecting much as ive played a lot of VR games but I just love it, the concept of the lab experiment gone wrong and lost in some dimension, the graphics look nice, the puzzles are not all that hard but the way you interact with them and the lights and effects is great, just great looking game and fun to just move things into place, an unexpected favourite game for me as it 2020 and this was out it 2017, everything is done so well, and on my level of weird.Like the silver sphere and the sounds reminds me of Phantasm was waiting for the tall man to show up.
played on Rift S with touch controllers, worked perfect.
 
NN-Dimension
1,502 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2020
PLAYED ON SAMSUNG ODYSSEY+

Though short, FORM is worth it just for the experience. I didn't run into any technical issues playing this game.

The story is very very light weight, and most of the time you are completing puzzles. I was very skeptical about this game because I am not at all a puzzle game person. However, FORM is so visually interesting that I wasn't once bored or frustrated. The puzzles are of medium difficulty. The hardest puzzles are just trial and error, honestly. This game would be good for people of all skill levels.

The only negative thing I would say about this game is that I want more of it, and the ending feels only like the beginning. Which I suppose is fitting for the theme of the game.

I would highly recommend this game for those who are just getting starting in VR or those who was a truly brand new experience.

I enjoyed this a lot... and I would pay for more of this quality. Puzzles were fun, not too easy or hard, with everything in very refined eye candy.

I have to say that the SOUND DESIGN was incredible, really enjoyed that.

Ran smoothly on the Vive Pro. Felt a bit short, but was a great experience, and I felt it was worth the bucks.

In a few words, this game is pretty good despite being very short.
I loved the audio design and the visual design of the game. The puzzle didn't seem too easy because there was a big variety.
I finished it in about an hour so it was really easy for me, but I'm used to puzzle games, so I instantly knew what to do. Or maybe the game design was great so that I instantly knew how to solve these. Can't tell.
Anyway, I'd say it's definitely worth picking it up when it's on sale.

Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2020
Form is a good puzzle game, and a great first or second game for anyone new to VR. Form relies first on atmosphere and graphics to immerse you, then upon the puzzles themselves to engage you. I found the puzzles not too easy or too hard. It's a relatively quick experience, but personally, I appreciate something I can finish and not spend 100 hours on. You pay $15 to go see a 2 hour movie, and you can't even interact with that. Think about THAT!

It's also impressive for it's time, as one of the first wave VR games. I recommend waiting for it to go on sale for $10.

Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2018
Produit remboursé

game lasted 30 minutes and didn't have a single challenging puzzle. Gameplay is like The Room in VR but where the puzzles in The Room always feel rewarding and exciting, the puzzles in this generally just give you the answer and the "challenge" is inputting it into the puzzle, looking back and forth between the solution and the puzzle. This would be ok if the puzzles later in the game became more challenging, but the game ends before you can get to "later in the game". Whole thing feels completely unfinished
 
Nuunuu
1,085 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Simply put, FORM may be the most unexpectedly enjoyable VR experience I've played in recent memory. It's intensely atmospheric, VISUALLY STUNNING (let me repeat that in case you missed it - VISUALLY STUNNING), and polished in a way I've never seen before from such a small indie team. The animation quality, the sound design, the art style - they're all spectacular, and all combine perfectly to make for a very unique VR experience.

Yes - it is short for a $20 game (with only 2 or so hours of gameplay)
No - the puzzles aren't groundbreaking (or complicated, really)
And no - there isn't much in terms of replayability...

BUT these flaws pale in comparison to everything FORM gets right. At a certain point, I didn't even mind if puzzles became repetitive because I was so invested in seeing what crazy environment I'd stumble into next. Solving puzzles was insanely satisfying simply due to the animation quality and auditory feedback, making each and every interaction with the world around you feel fantastic.

If you're strapped for cash, throw it on your Wishlist and wait for a sale - if not, definitely just pick this one up and enjoy the ride.
 
OBAMA CUBE
371 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2020
Короткая головоломка, которую точно стоит брать по скидке. За 100р игра определенно заслуживает внимания.
Как такового сюжета мне уловить не удалось, однако даже с незнанием английского игра представляет из себя набор головоломок, которые тесно переплетаясь друг между другом продвигают нас по сюжету.
Приятная графика, эффекты, музыка и общая атмосфера.
Да, проходиться за полтора часа (если вы тупой, как я, например), но в процессе прохождения прямо радуешься успехам и тому, что ты наконец допер куда провернуть очередную деталь головоломки, чтобы все точно сложилось.

Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2020
Выглядит и звучит очень круто. Объекты сияют, отбрасывая интересные тени на грани странного техномира, окружающиего тебя. Загадки пространственные, на релакс. Есть закадровый сюжет. Особый тип медитативных игр, мне еще нравится Luna. Из особенностей - стоишь на месте, перемещаешься тольк вместе с сюжетом. Короткая.

Caseter6
276 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2017
Genuinely a fascinating experience. Nothing else quite like it or at this level of quality on the Vive at the time of review. Amazing visuals - fun puzzles - intriguing storyline (albeit not really too important to the mission at hand). Its genuinely something you've got to try. At this time beyond the main game there is a really cool "interactive soundtrack" style area called the Cortex where by flicking a button you can toy around with sounds/colours in a series of environments.

The only downside to it is its over too fast. Just over an hour was enough time for me to soak in all the visuals and complete all the puzzles. Was hoping for a more definitive ending after all that, but if its leaving way for a sequel or DLC i'm all game. Still due to its length i'd really recommend getting this on sale if possible. As many others have said similar puzzle experience to The Room, but the environments in FORM are truly something you've got to see firsthand in VR to truly appreciate. Definitely a keeper just so I can let others playthrough :)
 
Drge
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 février 2019
If my friends asked me to show them why I bought a vr headset, I would show them Beat Saber and pretend this game doesn't exist.

If I wanted to put together a jigsaw puzzle, I would go to wally-world and buy a jigsaw puzzle, not strap a thousand-dollar piece of electronics to my face.
This entire game can be summed up as: "Put the thing in the thing. Now, put the thing in the thing. Wooooooosh. Ok, now put the thing in the thing." It's like watching a powerpoint presentation, but instead of pressing a button to go to the next wooshing geometry, you put a thing in a thing. At the end of it, you play simon-says, and then put a thing in a thing.

Any time this game flaunted its "story," I would roll my eyes so much, I thought my headset was losing tracking. The dumb interruptions between puzzles do not progress in any way that resembles a story, nor do they add anything to the game's "world." Make no mistake: This is not Portal, where the story grounds the player in the world, where characters evolve, and the game ends with a satisfying conclusion. The story is wholly divorced from the wooshing geometry the player sees, except for one snippet where unknown side characters blab about a thingy, saying it's sooooo mysterious. Nobody changes, nothing is explained, and all of it is pointless.
Oh, and the puzzles are lame.

I want my 0.9 hours back.
 
Big Sir

Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2017
+Immersive
+Great puzzles
+Breathtaking
+Creative

-Expensive for 1hr-ish

4/5

Aside for being expensive. This game left my Jaw on the floor, Finished it, then sat on the floor blown away. It's truly a beautiful somewhat short puzzle experience. The music and ambiance really get you sucked into the game, the puzzles although easy, were fun. For the price, it may not be worth it to some, but from what the game was, I enjoyed it, and feel I got my moneys worth from it.

If you liked this review Make sure to Click here and give a follow for more reviews of good, bad and decent VR titles. And Click here if you want to request reviews on other VR titles.

deffjay
9 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2017
I'm torn on this one. I expected the puzzles to be more challenging. By the end of the (less than one hour!) game, it began to feel tedious, since every puzzle involves making things match up. The Witness, for example, has some similar concepts but develops them more creatively. It made me feel brilliant; FORM didn't. Nevertheless, FORM charmed me with its beauty and skilled use of VR interaction. The graphics and animation were stunning (if minimalist). The physics felt realistic and the immersion was strong. The simple puzzles meant I never felt really stuck and I could just enjoy the flow. It was a pleasant experience, and I'll probably demo it to friends, so I felt like I got my money's worth. Just don't expect too much.
 
adrianquark
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2017
Whilst on the short-side of things; FORM is a beautiful game to play. The designs and environments whilst abstract and slightly 'oppressive' (for the lack of words for describing some higher dimensional geometrically inclined fever dream!) offer some genuinely creative moments of VR puzzling. I really must admire the care given to the experience, including the sense of progression and empowerment (particularly in the 'right' chamber) through the puzzles.

My only critiques would be that to those who are puzzle-savvy, it is possibly a little high on the price side for the time taken to complete the experience. My other critique is I was certainly yearning for more gameplay after completing it! I really wish it had a few more 'chambers' before resolving!

On a side note; I would say to those of you who like to 'throw your friends into VR'; this game would certainly be a good one for showcasing what VR can do.

Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2017
Great little gem of a game! Very evocative of The Room. The environments are spectacular and really make great use of the scope and depth a VR experience can deliver. Very inventive ideas, beautifully executed.

Ultimately too short... I got through it in 70 minutes. I wanted another hour or two of puzzling! It felt like the opening chapter to a longer story...

I don't feel like the full price was a waste.
 
spool32
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2017
Very interesting puzzle VR game.
To me it's a mix of The room with some cool ideas of The Lab.
Two great games combined together to create a fantastic VR experience.

What I liked :
- cool interactions with the environment
- beautiful lighting
- nice sense of scale and dimension
- fun to play with the objects and solve the puzzles

What I disliked :
- Not much of a story. I would have loved solving all those puzzles with an actual goal, or to have a stronger storytelling to care about.
Add that on your next game and that will be a masterpiece :)


Definitely recommend the game as a super cool VR experience.
Oh and it's 1h long, but who cares ? I really prefer having 1h of amazing VR experience than 20h of a boring VR game ;)
 
smashouille

Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2017
The visual craftsmanship on this game is stunning. Although the puzzles are easy, they are still satisfying and never frustrating. The main payoff is in the presentation and progression.

It's short, but was certainly worth the price for me since I love these types of games. If you are unsure, wishlist it and wait for a sale.

If you have a SubPac M2 (bass backpack), use it with FORM for the ULTIMATE TRASCENDENCE!

Do you like 'The Room' series of games on iPad? So you like Sci-Fi? If yes to both then this is a great little game you'll probably enjoy. Its quite short (I finished it in 1.5 hours) but still worth the asking price. Incredible attention to detail makes it feel like a piece of scifi art as well as a good puzzle game.

There are one or two genuinely new mechanisms in here (new to me at least) - and all the VR interactions and mechanics were great.

I'd have liked a few more levels but I can see how much time and effort has gone into crafting what is there already, so I'm not bitter.

Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2017
Rift user here - A very highly polished game from a team who really get the possibilities of VR., Definetely an engaging 90 minutes for me . At times I catch myself feeling that childlike delight in play that I haven't felt for a long while . Sound design and spatialisation is particularly good. I can'tsay I really followed the story what there was of it , but that didn't detract.

Some of the puzzles seem almost intuitive ..sometimes I got through them without fully understanding what I was looking for . Just the right level of difficulty . Everything smooth running 1.5X supersampling on Steam VR on my i5 / GTX 1060. The trigger button to grip things sucked, but hopefully that will be directed to the grip buttons for the Oculus ready version,

Stunning bit of work team, look forward to the next isntallment of Form !

Interesting to have a look at the reviews too...all exceptionally articulate and positive.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2017
A very atmospheric puzzle game. The puzzles are not that hard, but the implementation, the visual style is excellent. I took 1 hour to complete it.

The sort of puzzles you get are for example a kind of "Simon says" game, where you have to memorize color patterns or you have to align different forms, attached to a string, which you have to place in the right spot.

The music is decent and goes well with the whole experience.

I really recommend this game. It has the right VR feel, and I caught myself grinning in 2-3 occasions, which I only do, when I really am impressed by a scene in VR.

Hope to see more from those developers, maybe even some new content for this game.

Well done.

Évaluation publiée le 7 juin 2017
Still playing- Keep the reviews up- the developer has a fantastic grasp of what makes VR work! Other developers should be paying close attention. Aesthetics, careful use of space and light, enjoyabe puzzles that at times have you feeling like some sort of cyper-orchestrator ! - some classical music scenes would work a treat.

This awareness of aesthetics is missing from countless developers without the slightest clue of the power of having strong visual communication and design talent onboard.

Still playing- but if you enjoy this and would like to see this sort of experience evolve further- than support this developer. I am reasonably sure this is a very small and young team- who have demonstrated a fantastic grasp of the medium.

I will be submitting a full review once complete !

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2017
FORM almost immediately reminded me of the The Room series of games with its tactile, intricate puzzles. The game is gorgeous and does an incredible job creating its atmosphere. There's a decent variety in the puzzle design and a lot of great visual effects as you progress though each step of a solution.

I really wish there were more to the game. It's relatively short and I finished in just under an hour. It may take longer if you get stuck on any of the puzzles but overall I wouldn't expect more than a couple hours in total. That said, this game is absolutely worth the money and is one of the best VR games I've played since I bought my VIVE.

I really hope this gets a sequel or we at least see more from Charm Games.
 
Pistachio Jones
2,648 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2017
Summary

+ Beautiful Experience
+ Cool puzzles

Review

If anyone remembers enjoying the Lucasfilm Game called Loom from the 1990's on the Commodre Amiga, you are going to love this. I really wonder if the dev team played Loom because there are some very clear references.

Form is a great experience and I played it through in one go because I did not want to stop. It took me 99 minutes, but you may do it quicker. I paid around the price of a cinema ticket so although some call this game short, for me it was worth the admission price easily.

The unique soundtrack was very cool, but I admit wondering how cool it would have been with a Vangelis soundtrack - you get the idea anyway, very cool audio experience to go with a superb visual experience.

It was one of those games that I took a seat and sat through the end credits, 'cause it felt like the right thing to do.

GGz Dev team, congrats on a great FR experience.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2017
Bravo developers, I have had the Vive since it first came out last year and I can honestly say that if this had been a stage play I would be on my feet calling for an encore and clapping till my hands hurt. Everything is done right. The optimisation is perfect, it did not stress my GPU or CPU, the gameplay is as smooth as butter and the graphics quality is superb in every respect and that is with no supersampling at all ! It may be short , but , I in no way feel cheated. This is what VR should be. It gave me that same WOW feeling I had when I first put on the HMD and made my first baloon in the LAB. I can not praise this experience enough.

Again, bravo developers!!..I wait impatiently for more from your studio, you have raised the bar for all devs.

And to anyone who has a Vive, GET IT it is worth the money and then some.

oktomus
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2019
For those out there like myself, I feel like I must NOT recommend this game, especially since the 90% positive reviews are a bit misleading. At $15 it's way overpriced.

Now, I've played games most my life, and even though this is one of my first full VR experiences, I still felt let down. I think my review is for anyone whose grown up around video games and finds simple game puzzles to be a chore rather than stimulating.

As a disclaimer, I'm using an Oculous Rift S, and still being new to VR, I was feeling some VR exhaustion. I probably should have broken it into 2-3 sessions as recommended in the game.

---SPOILERS BELOW---

Length: Disappointingly Short.
I came in knowing it was short and maybe a bit simple. But the puzzles were neat, but very basic. For instance, the final puzzle, while beautiful and probably my favorite VR visual thus far, was literally 4-5 turns of the pattern repeating game "Simon". There are basically only two rooms/sections with any real puzzling to do, and then it's over. I finished the second room, went up some stairs expecting a final room or puzzle and then the game just ends. I was left saying, "That's it?"

Story: Vague and Lacking.
There are a lot of good elements. Good voice acting, interesting environment, a mysterious artifact, a man who pushes the limits for scientific discovery (maybe due to cosmic or divine intervention). But the game just kind of ends as things are starting to get interesting. There's a flashback section, and I was hoping for a couple more of those, but one was it. All in all, I didn't feel invested enough yet to care about the conclusion.

Game Play: It's All Puzzles.
That's fine, but...

Puzzles: Beautiful but Boring.
Puzzles were visually and mechanically neat. But, growing up playing video games, they all still felt familiar and basic. I think they are probably meant to be that simple, and are likely great for people like my parents or new comers to gaming.

Value: Way overpriced.
I'm baffled that this originally cost $15. It's worth $5 tops, and even then, you're not getting much. I got it in a bundle, and it essentially cost me $4; even that feels a bit much. I played Waltz of the Wizard and while it sold itself as a VR demo, I was surprised to discover depth. While WotW has an extended edition, it's base edition is free, and I've gotten far more out of that thus far.

Final Conclusion: Get it if the Price is Right.
I hate saying it, but outside of nice visuals and a nice gentle VR experience, this becomes a bargain-bin game at the asking price of $15. If it were free or $5 originally, I'd say it's a gem. I think a lot of time and effort and care went into making this, and I respect the creators for doing what they did, but I still can't recommend it unless on steep discount.
 
Red Bread Froggy
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Tiran Kenja
300 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2020
This game functions as exhibit "A" with respect to how a proper VR puzzle game ought to begin. Originality oozes from the hands-on interaction of shapes and patterns, which utilizes the technology's capabilities excellently. Where the game stops far short is in the narrative and length—or lack thereof. "Major" storyline moments feel more like side-notes and fail to drive any sense of impact into the player. What could have been a lengthy developmental arc of core puzzle mechanics and scientific mystery felt, in the end, like an unfinished blueprint for a structure that received nothing more than computer simulations to validate its feasibility. The extremely short campaign, if it can be given such a title, has no authority to command the fifteen dollar sale price.

The scale of grandeur hooks players on a fantastic proof of concept (that VR brings a tangible freshness into the puzzle genre), but the lack of depth and length causes the game to utterly fail at delivering anything beyond an introductory experience.
 
Snowbrick
128 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
- Nice experience overall for a few bucks.
- Quite short (in particular for the regular price).
- Some of the puzzles are quite original while other ones are bland (and some frustrating).
- Liked the original Demo when it got out but when playing the full game - as of 2020 - not so much.
- In game image could have been more clear (its dark but its also somewhat blurry).
- Made me feel emotional at one point and had some moments with a nice ambiance but its all over the place and not balanced - I felt like the intro room and some of the near end game moment were great.

Wouldn't recommend -as of 2020- vs what there is around on the market but its not a "bad" game - it just way too short and barely touch the surface of what could have been done but overall will give it a recommended seeing the efforts put into it.
 
Sherlock's ☁(Ѽ)\V/(Ѽ)☁
0

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
Really great VR puzzle game, similar in style to The Room's puzzles, though definitely a bit easier. Especially liked the puzzle at the end with the music strings.

My biggest problem with the game is the price. It's $15 for a 1 hour game. That's really pricey; if you thought games like Batman Arkham VR were expensive at $20 for a 3 hour game (if you get 100%) then I can tell you it gets even worse.

However, this is definitely not one you'd be picking up at full price. Wait for a sale or you'll regret it. Usually goes 50% off.

7/10
