Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2019
FORM feels a lot like The Gallery: Heart of the Emberstone but without story, characters or exploration. All what's left is 1 hour game that has amazing visuals and abstract puzzles.

And those puzzles are not even good: most of them require putting stuff into stuff-shaped holes. That's kind of activity that even mice, ravens and small children are capable of. It does not feel satisfying for a grown-up human to solve such 'puzzle'.

FireAza
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2018
"Hey, I kinda liked 'The Room', but I want it to be in VR."

Welp, here ya go.

FORM is a puzzler VR experience of about an hour and with almost zero replayability. It appears to have come from the Occulus side of the universe, so it doesn't benefit from room-scale play at all. The lack of height setting means you're still going to benefit from a place to sit and stand in your play space, though.

The puzzles are relatively easy, but they're very well designed and fit in VR quite well. The world is pretty, but whatever story is supposed to be hiding in here is... well, it's pretty bad. Like, I'd rather they put in another puzzle or two and just skipped trying to tell a story.

Still, I was somewhat disappointed when I finished the game that it was so short. On the other hand, there were some puzzles that seemed to take forever. There was at least one puzzle that I still don't know the point of and I only completed it by brute-forcing the solution.

Regardless, it gets a recommendation from me. I don't know if I agree it is worth the current asking price of $15, but I think it was a great deal during a Steam Sale, and it would be a pretty good game to keep in the library for showing guests examples of well-done VR games.

Это то, чего не хватает VR – безумно красивых игр! Просто муражки по коже! Если у вас есть VR и вы видите эту игру со скидкой, вы просто обязаны это купить! И пофиг, что эта игр длиться всего час – за этот час я испытал больше эмоций, чем в любой из 5-10-часовых VR-игр!
Для понимание сюжета нужно хорошее понимание английского (субтитров нет), но не понимая сюжет, вы абсолютно ничего не теряете.

Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
Beautifully produced, nice visuals and sound, but as others have said it's 1 hour long with no replayability. Puzzles are "put the square on the square and the triangle on the triangle", then "repeat a sequence of 4 color-coded notes", then the game tells you you're a genius. I felt like a baby at a shape table. No story to speak of. I suppose there must be a few Easter eggs in the environment, but having played through once I'm not feeling going back...memo to developers, a lot of white light is not the same thing as transcending existence.

o_O
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2021
I was standing in the middle of the night, trees around me, feeling chilly and staring at the game's menu. I created a new game and appeared in front of Dr. Eli's workspace. Dr. Eli is examining an ancient artifact and is on the bring of a discovery. You as Dr. Eli manage to somehow synchronize with the artifact and you wake up in your own mind where ideas can be read. Here you solve puzzles and eventually meet another sentient being.

The game is beautiful. The visuals are simply mesmerizing. The objects you manipulate are very well crafted and feel very solid even though you can't really touch them. As a player you can't walk around, you just appear in front of your puzzle and what you need you can reach (or bring it to yourself). After each step of a puzzle is complete the environment changes a bit and new part of the object/puzzle is shown to you. All the animations showing new stuff are pretty neat. They are visually pleasing and the sound that accompanies it is great. The soundtrack made me feel a bit strange though.

As for the story, I wouldn't even call it a story. It doesn't really have an ending or any kind of resolution. We don't learn anything about Dr. Eli, nor his wife. While the voice acting and intro are good the rest simply doesn't exist. I wish I would have found out more about Dr. Eli, his past or his personality. We don't even know what the artifact is, where it came from and who the unknown beings are. This way all I can say is that I was very disappointed because I expected at least some kind of a basic story.

Game play seemed to be similarly lacking. The puzzles are mostly of one kind and that is match two objects together. The 'puzzles' become rather repetitive. They are not hard but it still takes time to manipulate everything. Sometimes you have to look through a blue ball to see more information but that's about it. In the second room you have to play certain melodies. Be it either by sound or color which was even less entertaining even though it sounded cool. If this game was supposed to be a puzzle game I'd expect a certain variety of puzzles and something that actually requires you to think a little (at least sometimes).

Verdict:
The game is short. I finished it in 77 minutes which included me staring at the different environments and doing some nonsense with objects producing light. While I enjoyed doing that it was the only thing I could do, since you can't walk around. To sum it up, the game is visually breathtaking. It's a bit dark and blurry but atmosphere is great. The soundtrack and sound effects are great and make you feel more otherworldly. Animations are great to look at and while the game gives you all the time in the universe to solve a puzzle there is some kind of a fast paced flow to how everything moves and shifts around. I liked that. Story is nowhere to be found. Game play is simple, tedious and repetitive. Nothing to actually enjoy.

I would recommend this game to someone who wants to see some nice abstract things in VR and only if they just want to try to manipulate some objects and enjoy what they do (meaning they have no expectations of game content). Otherwise I'd say this game is not worth its full price and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

 
STsung
186 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2019
Finished the game in under an hour, then I messed around a bit in the interactive music mode.

The puzzles are not like in escape the room games, where you must walk around, and bring one item with you to unlock something in another room. The puzzles have a sort of alien feel to them, complex designs, yet they don't require 500+ iQ and telepathic mind powers to solve.

Quite the enjoyable game to play actually, definitely going to play again!

It's too short, the puzzles are too easy, the story doesn't make sense, it isn't interesting, and it goes into reprojection on my 3770K & 1080 Ti FTW3. 1,046 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2018
Great presentation and sound design but little to hold onto after it's done and as soon as it really gets you hooked, it's over. Puzzles were unique in design but simple to move past and the story, which should be a big driving force, leaves little impact until, once again, the very end. While there are two separate endings, the game plays exactly the same right up until that one and only decision meaning there is very little replay value. There's not even anything else beyond being able to play with the game's interactive soundtrack, compounding my issues with the game's style over substance. I'd consider waiting for a sale if you want to give it a try. The asking price is just too much for an hour's worth of play and (I'm guessing) 2 minutes of replay value (At time of review, I haven't seen the alternate ending) not even an alternate ending [just smart enough to avoid the fool's trap the first time around] that for me, is visually impressive but toothless in design.
 
Ed, Edd, and E.D.
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2018
Hmmm, this is a difficult one. On the one hand the game is gorgeous and atmospheric, on the other it's really sort and very easy. It's easily completed in under an hour; I stayed around and messed with some extras, which is why I played for just over an hour. For the asking price of £11 it's a bit of a tough sell. Worse, you could finish it and refund it for the time it takes to play. I'm not going to do that because I very much enjoyed it and want to show it to family/friends, but I could and that's something the developers need to be aware of.

On balance I'm going to rate FORM positively, BUT I would only advise buying it on discount unless you have the money to throw at VR games on a whim. For anybody concerned with the cost/length ratio this really isn't a good value proposition.

138 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2018
I must apologise to the developer... when this game launched last year I refused to buy it solely on the basis that the game could be completed within one hour. Generally I buy VR games that have no end (simulation/space) or games with long play-time (skyrim VR, Fallout 4 VR).

I was told by many that this game was amazing despite the compact length. Eventually I purchased (many months ago) but only played it for 10 minutes before going off and doing something else.

Last night I decided to return and continue play:

Spectacular audio and visuals, interesting puzzles in an otherworld setting converge to make this a great showcase for the future of VR.

So of course I will be waiting for the developer's next game and it has made me reavaluate my rule on excluding short games (but only for exceptional cases).

Zentric Egg
 
zentric egg
353 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2018
NO SPOILER REVIEW:

System being used:
VIVE Pro, Pro controllers and 2.0 sensors, i9-7900X, 1080 and 32 GB RAM

This is the kind of game that makes VR so much better than flat-screen gaming.

If you want an immersive experience where you have to figure things out on your own without any hand-holding along the lines of games like "The Room", then you'll love this.

The puzzles are pretty fun, some of them are a bit repetitive and once you get the hang of the puzzle, it's just really a matter of getting through it as it becomes more complex.

The overall difficulty I would say is "easy" as far as the puzzles go. Generally you can get through the entire game in about an hour if you have a decent head on your shoulders. Longer if you want to really take things in and really experience the game.

Most of the puzzles only use one type of logic or turn one way or have tracks or some kind of really obvious clue as to what you need to do. SO, really it's more about the experience, which is fantastic.
 
Bacon Overlord®
5,461 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2018
I'm really torn on this. On one hand, FORM is unique. The visuals and sound design are top notch for VR. Some really striking imagery and settings on display. The score fits it perfectly. Animation is interesting and melds the two well... In terms of presentation it's easily top tier out of all the VR experiences I've tried.

On the other hand it's 50 minutes long and none of the puzzles are challenging in the least. There's no replayability either, since it's a completely linear experience. As such I definatly do not think it's worth £10.99. I know distilling a recommendation down to a gameplay/cash ratio isn't usually a good idea, but 50 minutes for 10.99 just doesn't stack up well against other VR things I've tried.

That being said I'm going to thumb it up anyway. With the caveat of only as long as it's on sale. It's well worth experiencing at least once, and I'll keep it in my library to show friends and family. It's a game that lives and dies entirely on the aesthetics, so make sure you want to spend the better part of an hour in the screenshots above and you'll be in for a treat.
 
fenrif
1,775 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2018
Since the game has overall positive reviews i'll give it a negative one.
The game is very pretty and if you have more money than you know what to do with it by all means get this game for a nice 45 minute experience.
But the puzzles were way to easy and got annoyingly repetitive (as in, a lot of puzzles get repeated 3 times with just more to do, not actually getting more difficult).
The premise of the story seems interesting but is not developed in any meaningful way.
I can recommend this game as a showcase game to introduce friends and family to VR but not for the pleasure of vr owners.
 
Kalado
1,112 produits enregistrés
3
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2019
To start, only an hours worth of game play, with almost no reply value. With that on the table, this experience is a 10/10 for that entire hour, no matter what kind of gamer you are. I'm not big on puzzle games, but this entire experience had me craving more.

It's like an expensive VR chocolate... tastes incredibly good, everyone will like it, and yet not a good value. Won't satisfy your appetite. But everyone should try it once. While it's an artistic achievement, there's a little bit of me that is perturbed the makers did all the ground work and then stopped so early. It seems like with a fraction of the effort it took to get to this point, they could double or triple the game length.

Both a "must play for everyone" and an "only when it's on sale". If it had more game play, say 3 hours worth minimum, this would be deserving of an "Overwhelmingly Positive" review strength. As it is, "Very Positive" is more than fair.
 
Jeebus (I died for your wins)
299 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mai 2018
Produit remboursé

This game suffers from a common problem that plagues some VR games - it's not really a VR game, just a 2D game transformed to work with a VR headset and motion controls. It could've worked 1:1 in 2d and nothing would've changed. It's short and its puzzles are lackluster, but the scenery is astounding, though VR doesn't do anything for it. There's no reason to play this in VR, but take VR away and you're left with a short puzzle game that doesn't stand out with those puzzles in any way.
Maybe it's more a silly nitpick, but the environments aren't alien enough for me personally. I wish sci-fi designers would think about how aliens interact with the world, instead of taking human interfaces and giving them a bizzare look. With how easy puzzles were, I don't see why it couldn't have been done.
 
mitori

Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mai 2021
How have I not reviewed this Gem?! FORM might be in the top 25 or so best VR experiences. It is so gorgeously, intricatly well done graphically, and in terms of it's exquisite set of interaction puzzles. If you liked The Room VR Dark Matter and it's endless intricate puzzle boxes, you're going to go nuts over Form. It's all ton up in some kinda techno heaven and they mastered VR darkness and lighting and that. There is a story to this, and its emotional and about death, it should work to set the mood during the cosmic sequences. Worth every penny. Form is devine.

Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2023
I struggle to call FORM a puzzle game. It's more like a one hour long interactive movie with a few puzzle elements. About three of those can actually be called puzzles and the rest are a very fancy variant of the kids toy where you need to put the square peg into the square hole.
Nonetheless, I still recommend buying it but be aware that you'll mostly get a pretty sci-fi movie, not a mysterious puzzle game.

For the sale price I picked it up at, FORM is an enjoyable way to spend an hour.

Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2022
A fun experience. Something cool to show people who haven't experienced VR before.
Puzzles are simple but very satisfying to complete - some nice mechanics that I've not seen in other VR games to date. Everything is chunky and tactile.
Get it in a sale as it's not worth the full asking price (currently 10.99 in 2022) - you will finish it in a leisurely (and enjoyable) 60 minutes, but probably won't replay it.

at 1 hour playtime, it is very expensive, so i would strongly suggest getting it on sale.
i had a good time, the puzzles are varied and interresting while not beeing to hard.

at a sidenote, it seems to use more VRAM than my usual games, so i had to reduce the resolution a bit to get rid of the resulting stuttering. and you cant grip anything normaly, you have to use the triggerbuttons to grab.

i still recommend it, as i said, i had a good time with it and the atmosphere is realy good. i totaly felt like being tested by aliens. ;)

Absolut empfehlenswert. Ein sehr sehr schönes Spiel mit großartiger Grafik. Die Rätsel sind nicht so schwer, kann aber den einen oder anderen herausforden. Highly Recommended. A very very nice game with great graphics. The puzzles are not that difficult, but can challenge one or the other. Unfortunately it's a bit short with 81 minutes playing time. I look forward to more of this. Tip: buy on special offer together with Twilight Path, which also comes from the publisher.
 
<<G.A.I.>> MAG
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2022
I highly recommend this game as a visual experience!

Upfront, this is not a long game. It took me about an hour, but I thought it was totally worth it!

This game has tremendous visuals! Early on you leave the real world, and journey into you own mind. Doing this in VR is staggering. The spaces that are created for you take full advantage of the immersive effects of VR.

The Puzzles and Narrative were good as a driver of the experience. The puzzles were not too hard, but the act of discovering how each worked in that environment was a joy for me. The story was simple, but served as a through line for the journey. Each did their job.

Overall, a great but short experience. Still the most stunning VR experience I have had to date!

Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2022
I bought my Oculus Quest 2 primarily for these kinds of experiences. Visual feast for the eyes with a mind blowing soundtrack.

No movement required really except to look around and use your hands. Puzzles were a joy and felt satisfying to solve. Not overly difficult. It feels like its meant to be an experience more than a hardcore puzzler.

I played it twice because there was a choice near the end I was curious about. Hence my play time.

I grabbed it on a good sale and do not regret it.

Ogress_Connoisseur
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
If you never played any other vr game then you might find it amusing but non of the games "puzzles" were challenging at all or used any interesting mechanics. They are all literal puzzles (put the pieces together) or put square shape in the square hole. Most of the longer ones were just tedious and it was a struggle to complete the game because i was so bored with it. The hands only have 2 animations and everything is stiff as wood.
For the work the devs had to put in, the price of 10$ is too much, i paid like 4 dollars and it was a fair price but the time i spent in the game would be better spent browsing memes.
The visuals or audio left no lasting impression on me.
I will keep it to show to people who had no contact with vr whatsoever but i feel like there are much better alternatives.
 
Finger

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2021
FORM rivals The Room for my favorite puzzle VR experience thus far. One critique is that the fitting of slide pieces can cause severe frustration and break the immersive experience is a negative way. I really love how this game manages to require thinking but it shines with its use of intuitive dexterity usage. Definitely buy this one, you won't be disappointed. Not sure about the replay value.

sliv85
362 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2021
Overview
FORM is pretty awesome. I don't know what this artstyle is called, the geometric, low-poly, edge-glow amalgamation that defines this game, but I've always had a softspot for the exact style and colors this game uses. It's definitely a game to vibe with.

Artstyle aside, the soundtrack is neat, lots of noise going on though so I didn't get to sit down and wow at it (there is a dedicated mode for this, I've yet to try it, but certainly will because the ambient tracks were awesome).

For the price? Not so hot. I could see this game being a smidge cheaper considering its length (I finished it in a single 52 minute sitting). I'd see $5 as a steal and $10 as about right.

The developer side of myself looks at this game as it if were technical implementation. It was missing that "finalized" feel to it. The development team gives me the vibe that they were tinkering with mechanics and put them into a housing that allowed them to showcase these mechanics in a manner digestible to the consumer.

Issues
I have no complaints aside from price/length. I got it on sale so I'm happy, but I would be a bit peeved if this is what I got at full price.

Suggestions & Feedback - What would fix the issues?
Well, I can say that "longer game" is a horrible answer at face value - these puzzle mechanics would get terribly boring if it were any longer, and it'd undoubtedly turn the image of the game for the worse. There's a different angle of attack to take that inadvertently satisfies the "longer game" desire, and I personally think this is the way to go right here: Make it into a story that is told as the player goes through the game, intermittently swapping between storytelling and interaction. Take a look at a title like Quantum Break for example. Use a storytelling mechanic like that and this game will shoot straight into the stars.

So should I get it?
Get it during the summer sale when the price is (ideally) put at 50% or less.
 
Xan // Eti
175 produits enregistrés

Pblack
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2021
Being a 2017 game Form might feel a bit old. You are standing still, looking in one direction only. Using your hands you solve puzzles. (This leads to no motion sickness at all.)
But, it's very well done. It's a finished products that "just works". No matter how stupid you handle yourself in the game, it seems you can't really mess it up. Also there are no timers etc. so it's a really calm experience.

Good game if you want to have some friends try out VR, but not having them smash controllers into walls etc.
The scenery will impress VR newbies, but not anyone used to more recent games.


For hardcore VR gamers in 2021, it's a bit too boring. The puzzles are mostly about figuring out WHAT to do, and then doing it a few times in more and more difficult ways. Honestly I thought to myself a few times... "More of this, again?" a few times in some of the longer puzzles.

Get it on sale if you feel like the price is right for about 1 hour of calm puzzle solving.
 
Tee

Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2021
was auch immer das gewesen sein soll, es lohnt sich nicht... wirr zusammengestellte rätsel, von der eher einfachen sorte, dafür muß man die dann mehmals hintereinander lösen... wenn man denn mal herausgefunden hat, das man gerade was machen soll... also meistens steht man ratlos da und weiß nicht was los ist.. hilfe, anleitung oder hinweise, was lost ist, gibt's keine... extrem kurz ist's im endeffekt auch noch... bei der umsetzung aber auch besser so... als einführungslevel wäre das was gewesen, bei einer entsprechenden hilfestellung / anleitung, aber ein ganzes spiel ist das sicherlich nicht... mehr ne art übung irgendwas in vr hinzubekommen...
nebenbei gibt's noch einige probleme mit der stabilität, SEHR niedrige framerate bzw. spiel hängt sich auf (steamvr behauptet keine verbindung zum hmd), nach einem neustart von steamvr (teilweise des ganzen systems) geht's wieder....

First, I strongly recommend buying this game on sale since it's too short for €12 (Many of the negative reviews mention short playtime or that it's too expensive)

I bought it on sale, and it has been a blast. The music is just perfect for the sci-fi setting, and the level design fits equally. The story is pretty straightforward and the puzzles are not really challenging but fun nevertheless.

I would view this game more as an interactive film than an actual game. However, it is still a nice experience.

This game is a beautiful art piece and experience...

that lasted 47 minutes.

I really wish there was more to it. The content just... ENDS. At the 15 dollar price tag (for that kind of time length), I can see the effort. But man, it's just left me wanting more. The puzzles were *very* easy, but mostly made good use of VR. The art direction and soundtrack were very nice.

Something about this game says "incomplete" to me. The sudden ending, the single flashback that comes and goes, the set pieces that look like so much effort was put in and could be interact-able but aren't, etc etc.

The game is rather short and can be completed in about an hour, basically you have to complete a series of rather easy puzzles. But this game is not so much about the puzzles, but the visuals in combination with a splendid atmospheric soundtrack and sound effects while playing.

Lamatiel
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2021
The bad; I finished it in 62 minutes. Controls are simplistic and the puzzles are almost infantile until maybe the last quarter when they at least get mildly stimulating but still easy. Some might find the audio puzzles near the end hard if you're not musically inclined. The good? Visuals, sounds, and general art direction are fantastic! Even by 2021 standards it looks good. It really feels like a surreal sci fi acid trip. A few times when the visuals get flashy and the bass hit I felt the hair on the back of my neck stand up. The closest I played to this is Red Matter (in tone, not so much game play) which I feel is a bit better and probably about 3 times longer but this is in that direction. Unfortunately the story line went over my head but it made me curious enough to try to (unsuccessfully) search the internet for an explanation. Yes, this is one of those VR "experiences" more so then a game but it's definitely one of the better ones. Probably not worth the full price but definitely worth picking up on sale.

Some interactions are hard to reach, but it wasn't too bad. I'm not a huge form of the blinding white light in VR, was afraid it is going to trigger my migraine, thankfully it didn't.

Mr.Furious
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2021
FORM is a very short, well-done but ultimately very basic puzzle adventure. As far as VR goes, there should be no issues with any VR beginners since it doesn't have any sudden position changes like falling and there is no moving. As far as puzzle enthusiasts are concerned, the puzzles are extremely neat and well done but very, very simple. The game doesn't overstay its welcome, it runs without hitches or glitches, but the puzzle elements are too simple and the story and the ending feel unfinished.

Atmosphere: 4/7
Puzzle design 4/7
Puzzle difficulty 2/7
VR experience 5/7
Length 2/7

TL;DR - very short atmospheric puzzler with nice design but very easy puzzles and an unfulfilling ending. Buy at a discount (I bought it on a 70% discount)
 
Mindtroverted
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2021
Definitely recommend this game! Along with everyone else, it did feel unfortunately short. But still a great VR experience I will likely be showing to many newcomers to VR. About an hour long.
I think it felt short because it is setting up that there will be 3 main stages, after completing what I thought was stage one and stage two, they unlocked the final segment, which was just the credits for the game. That was just a bummer to have right at the end when I was expecting about 1/3 more content.

Worth it on sale, definitely would have been upset if I paid full price (I paid $6.45AUD instead of $21.50AUD)

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2021
I enjoyed the experience. It took about an hour to complete.
* Visually this was a great experience.
* Puzzles were easy and sometimes repetetive. I didn't get stuck anywhere.
* Story - Feels like the project was short on budget and large parts of the story/cut scenes had to be cut out as a lot of questions were unanswered.

Get it on sale knowing it's an hour long. Go into this expecting a neat visual and audial expereince with intuitive puzzles. Don't expect too much from the story.

The Game was really short, but I still had a lot of fun playing it. For an indie game I think its worth it although I did get it on sale for less then $5 so its hard to complain. I'll probably play it again in the future and this will definitely be on the list of games that I have friends when they are first trying out VR or are only going to be over for a short period of time.

Expect to spend only about an hour to 1 hour 10 minutes to complete.

0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2021
Form does what VR does best: take you somewhere impossible. The abstract visuals, meditative gameplay, and precise playtime made it a welcome excuse to revisit VR. Although, I wouldn’t exactly label Form as a 'puzzle' game given the intuitive simplicity of most interactions. Still, moving cubes and pulling levers in VR continues to be a gratifying pastime, especially when your tampering is accompanied by a dynamic soundtrack and warped surroundings. It's strange that I hadn't come across Form earlier and easy to say that I loved every minute of it.
 
CasualCheetah
884 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2021
Wow - this was great. Like my favourite part of my body it is really very short, but I had a lot of fun with it.

Unlike my favourite parts of my body it created beautiful sounds and mesmerising patterns. It was a kind of a transcendental acid trip of a game. The puzzles are quite simple but worked nicely. The game feels polished and ran as a smooth as a Frenchman's breakfast. I bought it on sale for £3ish which feels about right. I'm not sure there is a lot replay value in it, although the interactive music thing looks nice.

Not quite on the same level as The Room VR, but similar in terms of puzzles, polish and general silky swish-ness.

It was a lot of fun for one evening, but was possibly not something that would keep you coming back - like my favourite part of....

...I'll get my coat.

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
If VR was more mature as a medium, with many great titles to choose from, I wouldn't recommend this game. It is a 56-minute long demo rather than a full-length game. But VR users are probably used to this being the case; HL:Alyx is the only "real" full-length single player game for the medium. So with that in mind, this is an okay-looking game (not great; it has no shadows even on best settings), with fairly easy puzzles that consist of fitting objects into holes, and a not-really-story that consists of disconnected sound bytes of cliche dialogue, and an unsatisfying and abrupt ending. In other words, it is an above-average VR game.
 
ShnitzelKiller
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2021
Short but beautiful little game.

PROS:
Good title to get your VR legs. You can just stand in one place the entire game.
Good hand/grab mechanics (better than most)
Very graphically detailed, really makes you feel you are there
Sound is wonderful, the music puzzle is my favourite.
Plays well on Valve Index.

♥♥♥♥:
Very short, can be completed in an hour. But take your time and look around. Enjoy the craftwork.
Your central placement may feel like your standing in the puzzle, I had to back up to view it all.
Some of the puzzles feel way too easy but make logical sense.
Get it on a sale when it's under $5.

It's the game that helped my wife get into VR. She loved the simplicity of the interface and the feeling of being in a huge area.
 
Zak1bud3k
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2020
I Love the aesthetic of this game and can't get enough of the premise of the game.

I don't play an awful lot of VR in general but when I do get the hankering I always do a complete run through of FORM (roughly an hour or 40 min now that I know all the puzzles off by heart) from start to finish in one sitting, I just find it so absorbing.

The puzzles are fairly easy to work out but I never saw this game as trying to be that challenging in the first place. All the puzzles are satisfying to complete and look interesting.

I wish it was a bit longer and while I'm glad the studio has continued to make more VR games I really wish they would return to the world of FORM and add more chapters.

It's a great VR game if you don't have much room, I have barely enough room for my VR setup and was able to set this up and want to come back to it time and again.

Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2020
all in all, it's a big "Eh".
This game reminds me of POLLEN, another game from 2016 that did the same thing of trying to be 2001: the VR game.
problem is, most games that try this think that the monolith was what made the movie interesting. 2001 was a movie about HAL and the crew, the monolith was a side detail that got all it's screentime at the start and end of the movie. The visuals are great but the game itself is really insubstantial. Most difficulties are from not knowing what you're supposed to interact with, or puzzles that just take a long ass time. (Looking at you, jigsaw.) Do not recommend, there's better VR games on steam for less.

1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2020
Some objects are a bit low for a tall person. I often find I need to crane my neck to look down in VR environments designed for shorter people. Index controllers don't quite match the virtual hand position and no finger tracking is a let down.
Could be enhanced with more haptic effects when interacting with items.

As with many VR titles it is fairly short. Nonetheless, FORM immerses you in the story well. Experimenting to solve interactive three dimensional puzzles yields satisfying visuals and audio.

Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2020
Right after I finished the demo, I bought the full version and started the download. And then I realized they're a local developer in Vancouver, so I jumped at the chance to support them. Really neat visuals, interesting puzzles, took about an hour to complete and only got temporarily stuck once. No locomotion, besides a couple of blink teleports, so friends without VR legs should be able to do this no problem and experience this. It's a bit short for the price, but it's about the same as a movie ticket, so give it a shot.

1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2020
Игра короткая, максимум на 1,5 часа, в которой вам нужно будет решить несколько головоломок. Но я рекомендую взять эту игру не столько из-за ее геймплея, сколько из-за офигенной атмосферы, которую удалось создать разработчикам. Я не могу объяснить конкретно, что меня так впечатлило, но несколько моментов у меня в буквальном смысле вызывали мурашки, а местами присутствовал просто какой-то необъяснимый страх (не схожий с таким, который бывает в хоррорах). Возможно это просто личное восприятие, и кто-то не почувствует вообще ничего, но попробовать стоит - лично мне эта игра отложилась в памяти, т.к. подарила такой необычный опыт.
 
Skambavr
256 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
This is a wonderfully immersive and visually stunning puzzle game. The soundtrack also deserves a mention as it complements the gameplay very nicely. Sadly, the game is extremely short and ends just as it begins to get interesting. I completed the game in under an hour and I was left wanting to know more about the story.

There isn't much replay value to be found here, unless you missed an achievement the first time. The puzzles make good use of VR but all in all they aren't very challenging, and going through them again would just be tedious. However, I think this game is great to use as an introduction to VR. It's unlikely to cause motion sickness, since it doesn't require the player to walk around and it's relatively slow-paced.

I got this game on a sale and I feel like I got my money's worth, but I would hesitate before paying full full price for this.

397 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2020
着席では物に手が届かなくてNGでした…
（非対応なのに「おすすめしない」にするのはおかしいですが、一応、報告も兼ねてということでご勘弁を…）

（2020/07/05追記）
立位でプレイできたので追記です。

パズルというより、ちょっと頭を使うVRデモという感じ。
パズルゲームを期待すると簡単すぎて肩透かし食らうかも。

VRデモとしては非常に優秀な部類。
グラフィックも綺麗だし、操作も比較的直感的でわかりやすい。

立位でプレイしていると地味に疲れるのだけど、
そろそろ座りたいなと思うくらいでクリアできるくらいのボリューム
値段を考えると少々あっさりかなぁという気もする。

1000円の価値があるかどうか微妙なラインだけど、
500円なら完全に買い。

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2020
Ein wirklich sehr hübsches Spiel, obwohl es sehr dunkel ist. Die Lichter und die Musik versüßen die Erfahrung und dabei kommt eine angenehme Atmosphäre auf. Die Rätsel sind recht simpel, machen aber Spaß.

Ich finde es absolut spielenswert, man kann es aber schon in 40 bis 50min durchspielen.
Das Spiel wird dabei durch eine Story begleitet, diese ist aber meiner Meinung nach nebensächlich und zudem nur auf Englisch.

Das Geld ist hier top investiert!

Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2020
Sehr cool. Stimmungsvolle Umgebung, sehr gute Grafik und tolle Musik und Soundeffekte. Die Rätsel waren ganz gut. Vielleicht nicht die aller schwierigsten, aber Spaß haben sie in jeden Fall gemacht und waren klasse dargestellt. Die Steuerung war sehr intuitiv und bedurfte eigentlich keiner Anleitung.
Das Spiel hatte ich in ziemlich genau einer Stunde durch. Für mich war es trotz der Kürze den Preis wert.
Da die Spielstände unter dem Titel "Prolog" gespeichert werden hoffe ich sehr, dass da noch ein längeres Spiel zu folgt, den es macht definitv Lust auf mehr.
 
Piranhawurm
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2020
A nice, sci-fi, puzzle game. Feels like the Room, but in VR, with Sci-fi crescendos with the music and sound. None of the puzzles are all that difficult. If you've played puzzle games, you've seen these sort of puzzles before. It was a nice experience with the typical, predictable ending.

If you've got someone whom hasn't done vr before that enjoys puzzle games, this would be a good first vr experience, little to no movement required, so no vr movement sickness.

I finished the game in just under an hour, so take that in account when purchasing.
 
CatPhoenix
4,620 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2020
I really don't know what to say about this game. It's kinda fun and the puzzles are pretty intuitive, but like, where's the content? I paid $15 for an hour of content? It also felt kinda clunky, and the fact that probably 70-80% of the more interesting puzzles are literally shown in the trailers kinda blows. Not sure if I was over-expecting for a game released in 2017 or if I just blew through it too quick or what, but literally just play the demo. I plaid that, and found it fun, and then got this game and got exactly twice the amount of content. I was thinking that I'd at least get like 4x the content of the demo, but I guess not.

Also, they seem to try and set up some story thing, and then never actually do anything with it, which is REALLY irritating, cuz your character references this disembodied voice (Sam) with little to no backstory (I think it's his wife or gf or something?) and then just leaves that out there with no resolution or explanation aside from at the very end, LITERALLY "You can't even understand..." from a DIFFERENT disembodied voice and no explanation for WHAT THE ACTUAL F*** is going on.

TL;DR- I wouldn't have such an issue if they didn't start to set up a story and then do nothing with it, but it's also too expensive for an hour of content.

P.S.: Ranting for a sec, but I kinda hate it how whenever people wanna say someone's like a savant or something, they use some basic ass math from like trigonometry floating around an object or a person, when it's like, come on we all have learned that sh** at some point can we see something more intense, like at least an integral or something? Anyways, that's unimportant to the game but this "scientist" can only visually think as smart as a high school junior, I guess...

If you're into sci-fi of any sort, get this game. You will love it!!!

Izzy Paradox
332 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2020
This game is very short and not very challenging. The puzzles can be summed up by if it glows grab it and wiggle it. There is a story but I really don't see why they bothered as nothing you're doing really gives you any feeling that you're progressing along it or finding anything exciting about why you're doing any of these lock and key puzzles. However if you find FORM on sale and you like a simple puzzle game then it is worth it. What it does do well is the graphics and flow from one puzzle to the next.

I think it needs at least 2 more zones and something a bit more challenging. e.g. If you returned to the lab with a new signal pattern every now and then, you could thematically have many zones and even if you got stuck on a puzzle, return to the lab and try a different zone.

If you are reading this and wondering about VR puzzle games then also look at Gnog as I think it's puzzles are more interesting, original and a bit tougher. If you're looking for a proper challenge then try The Talos Principle.
 
Wookie
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mars 2020
This is insane. I got the game on sale since I didn't think it was worth the full price, but I was wrong. I knew I'd like it since it's a puzzle game in VR, but I didn't expect what this game gave me. There isn't much content in the game (I completed it in ~65 minutes), so I thought about refunding it since it was done, but I just can't. After playing it, I was so blown away by the crazy visuals and unbelievable sound design that I am unable to even consider loosing it from my library. This game has incredible graphics, better than most other VR games I've played, and the sound design is absolutely stunning. This is simply one of those game that I'll show people who are new to VR, since it's just so interactive and really quite visually beautiful. I even took off my VR headphones to put on my wireless ones for better sound quality. I'd recommend buying it on sale though, just due to how short it is, but it's still a great game even so. This is the literal definition of "quality over quantity".

TLDR- It's a short game, but so unique and amazing that it's gonna be in my favorites list forever.
 
The_Impiersonator

Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2020
This is the kind of thing that VR needs more of. Interactive visual and audio experiences that transport you to a new world. The puzzles are simple enough that they don't take you out of the world you're in, and that also means that any age could easily jump into this game blind and have a great time. Charm Games did a wonderful job with this title. My only complaint is that it isn't any longer ;)

1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2020
An enjoyable, if simple, puzzle game. Felt very similar to The Room, in the sense that there are beautifully animated objects in front of you that you interact with to solve simple puzzles. The puzzles are easy - mostly something like "put the shape in the correctly sized hole" and there's a fair amount of repetition too. Couldn't recommend it at full price as I completed it in less than an hour, but worth playing at it's current 60% off.

Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2019
I finished this in just under 50 minutes, with several minutes just looking around and messing with the objects around me. The game was just too beautiful not to. The puzzles were gorgeous, the scenes were gorgeous, the sounds were gorgeous, the wife in the picture is gorgeous, and the apple was gorgeous. My only complaints are that I wish the coffee mug was filled and drinkable IRL, the game was longer, and the puzzles were a little more difficult. Great relaxing game that helped me decompress after an especially long day, I was not expecting this. I look forward to more from Charm Games.
 
John Smith
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2019
FORM, An Amazing VR Experience

I enjoyed this VR puzzle game, it is by far my favourite due to its style and mechanics.

I hope another is in the works, I played Twighlight Path, had fun, but it didn't come close to FORM.

If you own an Index this game is a must, the visual quality and sound are both amazing! The puzzles are fun, engaging and novel in VR. I was able to experience some VR moments I've longed for since getting my DK2.

I thoroughly recommend FORM and look forward to another release.

Second release:

Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2019
Produit remboursé

Ein grafisch schönes Spiel, aber die Puzzles sind kinderleicht.
Zudem sind viel Puzzles in Reihe sodass ich in 68 Minuten Spielzeit den Eindruck
hatte, dass wenig bis gar keine Story vorhanden ist.

Es erinnert mich ein bisschen an ein Spiel für Babys, wo man die richtige geometrische Form durch den richtigen
Ausschnitt stecken muss und ist nur geringfügig schwieriger.

Schade ,dass scheinbar das ganze Budget bei der Entwicklung in die Grafik geflossen ist und nicht in die Puzzles, ansonsten hätte es ein gutes Spiel werden können.

Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2019
Beautiful game with fun little puzzles. Today was only my second day ever using VR and this game felt very natural to play. Definitely would recommend as one of the first games one should play when learning VR controls and how to work with the space you have.
Only downside for me is the length! It's only about 45mins to an hour long, but honestly it was worth every minute.

I would definitely purchase a sequel or additional story content for this game.

Fred
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2019
Well, there's some great parts and some disappointing parts. Here's my thoughts;

Pro:
Great visuals and theme
Sounded good to me
Intuitive controls
Really interesting mechanics
Easy to figure out how the puzzles functioned
Interesting story(for what little is there)

♥♥♥:
Depressingly short
Alternates between really dark and really bright, to the point where I just closed my eyes or looked elsewhere for a few seconds
Simple puzzles
The end was a let down, all the buildup for that....

Summary: Form is a really nice game, it is really well polished, but it held little challenge or creative thinking, due to it's short length I can only recommend you buy it at a rather large percentage sale. I'm not a puzzle kind of person and I still liked this game, I just think it needs some hopefully more challenging content.

Ein Rätsel Spiel mit kleiner Hintergrundstory.
Umsetzung ist sehr gelungen so wie die Grafik.

Länge 1 Std.

Rätsel Schwierigkeit: Leicht

Im Sale lohnt sich das Spiel (4,99€) sonst zu Teuer im Vergleich zu anderen Spielen. (Vom Umfang des Spiels)

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 octobre 2019
Very compelling VR experience.. It felt a bit like being Jodie Foster's character in Contact, fiddling with alien technology and finding my way through. A lot of cool sound and alien tech designs. That said, it's pretty short. Puzzles were all fun but pretty easy. Playing through it start to finish (no doubt I missed a secret here or there) took about an hour. But, I got the game on sale for less than the cost of a movie ticket and think it was worth it. I'll probably have some friends play through it for the experience. It would be a good VR starter game for a lot of them. Epic feel without a lot of motion. All relatively straightforward.
 
Merrick
635 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2019
Well, I jut finished this experience. I can't say beat this game because its less a game and more of an experience. This has moments of why i invested in VR in the first place, to see the awesome and awe inspiring. The first time I entered the "room" I was struck and I have to say that at the right price that alone was worth it but for a "game" that only lasts a bit over 1.5 hours its hard to spend to much.

The puzzles are mostly easy. I'm not a puzzle guy and a couple I had to play around with and look around but I got them. The music one towards the end I liked best. The biggest fault of this game I think is that some of the puzzles had nothing to do with the .. world? There was no real story but enough intrigue to hope for a sequel to carry on.

I'd highly suggest this for the experience of it and I have to say, the worst part of this game is the fact you can only experience it for the first time once.

Zenobo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2019
Transcendent...
I was a late adopter to VR, because of my concerns over simulation sickness, but once I tried it for the first time on PSVR I was hooked. I even found that once I got my "VR legs" it actually helped with my problems with normal motion sickness, which had plagued me my entire life. That being said, as much as I have found a great amount of fun and escapism in the many VR games I own (over 70 at this point) I had never experienced one that moved me in such a visceral way and made Although the game isn't very long and the puzzles are not super taxing, the pure wonder that I experienced during my time with Form almost brought tears to my eyes. The jaw dropping visuals combined with the blissful auditory experience on display was like nothing I had ever experienced before and I cannot recommend Form enough! It definitely made me glad I upgraded to the Index. I have nothing but praise and gratitude to the developer who for a short time was able to transport me to another world beyond even my wildest dreams.
Keep up the great work guys!
 
neodivinexero
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2019
As a puzzle game enthusiast, I find this a very nice and playable game with interesting puzzles, an interesting environment, and some pleasant ambient music in the background. However, if, like me, you have a disability and have limited movement, this will be unplayable unless you have a little help, because you won't be able to reach many of the interactive objects. As usual, the developers assume that everybody is equally able to freely turn around, crouch, reach up and move backwards and forwards and side to side. Game makers could benefit if they were to provide optional controls to simulate such movements using the controllers, as they would capture more of market (i.e. disabled users). There is good news though, because help is available - there is a nice inexpensive little utility called WalkinVR which runs together with SteamVR and it allows you to configure your controllers to simulate the movements I mentioned above, so you can move and turn around within VR while physically remaining in a fixed position. I haven't been able to get WalkinVR to work with every game/application (maybe I need to learn more about it), but it worked perfectly well for me with this game.

Have you ever played something you wished would never end? This was one of those experiences. Wow- this is the best thing I have experienced in VR thus far. The visuals and sound were gorgeous. zxyra
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mai 2019
This is the kind of VR content I enjoy, so it's an easy recommendation for me.

It takes advantage of the platform, and I particularly like the decision of not letting the player move freely. The puzzles feel refreshing and never overstay their welcome. The puzzles are seamlessly integrated into huge machines, and fixing them allows you to enjoy impressive sequences. The graphics are top notch, and the inmersion is great.

I would like to see the devs expand on the concepts, the story, the puzzles and make a bigger game with some improvements.

The game is short, and some may find the price a bit high, so buy it on sale if you must. For me, it's worth the price.
 
OctopusOnFire
362 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2019
Das einzig negative was ich zu dem Game sagen kann das es eindeutig zu kurz ist, aber dennoch ein Audio/Visuelles Erlebniss der Extraklasse!

Es geht darum ein Signal zu entschlüsseln, das schöne an dem Game ist; das es VR wirklich gut ausnutzt. Man muß bei den Rätseln viel mit den Händen machen (was mir persönlich sehr gefällt).
Erinnert etwas an Tony Stark und das herumgeschiebe seiner Hologramme...

Wirklich schwer sind die Rätsel nicht, aber die Umsetzung mit "morphenden" oder "transformierenden" Teilen / Gegenständen ist sehr überzeugend. Ein wirklich phantastisches Erlebnis.
Das Audioerlebnis ist, wie ich finde, sehr passend, bei den teilweise "archaischen" Klängen heben sich hier und da die Nackenhaare (auf eine angenehme, sehr beeindruckende Art). Die Gitarrenriffs am Ende zu sind beinahe episch, zumindest vom Gefühl her, da diese Grafisch untermalt werden und eben durch VR dieses "mittendrinn" Gefühl sehr präsent ist.

Vom Preis her... muß ich sagen K ich hab mich in das Game verliebt und ich würd's auch für'n Zwanni immer wieder kaufen...

Das Game eignet sich auch hervorragend und z.B. auf ner Party oder sonstwas, Leute an VR ranzuführen oder denen mal ein Gefühl dafür zu vermitteln wozu die imstande ist.

Also nochmal DAUMEN HOCH, kaufen & genießen !!

Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2019
First off, there is approximately 1 hour of gameplay here, but that hour is a great demonstartion of what's possible with VR environment interaction. It's a roomscale puzzle box where the answers are always rather obvious, but still satisfying to complete. There's a little bit of story, but the real focus of the game is finishing the puzzle in front of your face. I got it at 50% off, and despite the short length, it was worth that price.

Excellent game!! Ran through this in an hour, and enjoyed the whole thing. Controlled naturally, gorgeous graphics, and absolutely stunning sound design.
This game got me to post my first review after years on Steam.

Also pleased to note it was developed in my home city!
 
Sparky Broken Halo
260 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2019
Très séduit par la démo, j'ai acheté ce jeu sans lire les commentaires avant, je le regrette à moitié.
Le jeu est très beau, les animations bien rendues (sauf à la toute fin, impression qu'il manquait le raccord entre les 2 yeux en VR), on plonge vite dans l'ambiance et les sons viennent appuyer ça.
Les énigmes ne sont pas hyper compliquées, parfois on trouve l'astuce juste en essayant de manipuler des objets, presque sans le faire exprès.
Par contre, le jeu est vraiment trop court, en à peine 2h c'est plié, donc ça fait quand même un peu cher au final. Je l'ai pris en bundle avec Twilght Path du même éditeur, ça allège la note (pas encore essayé).
Même si je conseille le jeu parce que l'expérience est intéressante, je conseille aussi d'attendre d'éventuelles promos.

Petro
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mars 2019
AWESOME! I mean that in the true meaning of the word, this game is AWE inspiring and doesn't just provide an experience but also a feeling. If you liked games like Flower and Journey then you understand what this game is trying to give you. A tip... make time for it. Play the entire game without a break if you can. Pacing and momentum are part of the design and you only get one chance for a first playthrough.

Sad note, I've noticed that these games require a kind of mental and emotional maturity to truly appreciate. So if you're someone around the age of 19ish, ask yourself what you want in a game. If you have any expectations on what a game SHOULD be then wait to play this game. If you're open to solving a few puzzles and seeing what happens in the process then give it a try.

Caveat: It is kinda short. If you feel like you won't to get your money's worth at full price, then put it on your wish list and wait for a sale. That's what I did cause I'm poor, but no matter how you get it...worth every penny.

gdellanoce
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2019
FORM is, at its core, a simple geometric puzzler wrapped in a somewhat pretentious VR package. Whoops, boiled my review down too much there; let’s see if we can build on that.

The core gameplay involves using tracked motion controls to move knick-knacks and wotsits about to achieve some arbitrary goal, usually color and shape matching. Shapes and colors: confounders of preschoolers ‘round the galaxy. So long as you possess decent spatial reasoning the puzzles themselves aren't particularly challenging but are reasonably well done and certainly well-presented. The story is a right Wally, though.

The developers certainly put together a good core but it doesn’t feel like it fully goes the distance. It feels like it got partway into a story before the writer was abducted by aliens and the rest of the team had to finish the game around the notecards. It turns out the Unknown isn’t all that unknown when it’s a guy made of paper mâché talking down to you like you’re little Timmy stuck in a sewer drainpipe. Did it ever occur to you, Unknown-me-matey, that maybe I’d like a little mindfarkery before declaring that there’s no way I could comprehend? You haven’t exactly confounded me to this point. And some of the imagery is as subtle as a brick to the face; oh no, you touched a very Renaissance picture inscribed with a Metatron’s Cube and it flew apart so you have to reassemble it, mirroring the character’s rebuilding of themselves after trauma and after their soul is lain bare.

If I am full of complaints then why, by Dr. David Bowman’s hypothetical gonads, am I giving this a thumbs-up? The game does present itself quite well and even though the puzzles were simple it was still enjoyable to solve them. What’s there is highly polished and the environments were certainly well-designed. The art style is consistent and does lend itself to a sense of scale.

But is it $15 worth of a game? Well I've seen people pay a lot more for less (I’m looking at you, Bethesda) and I got it on sale but that’s not entirely a fair comparison. You could also compare it to the price people will pay for an ice sculpture of a swan that doesn’t last the week unless you live in the Arctic. Just on its own merits I would have to say yes* but if I could I would be highlighting that asterisk and erecting flashing neon signs. I would rather have paid $30 if it meant the game was twice as long and twice as complex. If the devs put out a $15 expansion pack that actually expanded on what they’ve already made I’d buy it, so long as it actually gives some kind of closure with its ending, not just suddenly cutti
 
R0AHN
706 produits enregistrés
0

Dislikes: Short

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 janvier 2019
This is what VR is all about. They really nailed it with this game, the disappointing part of it is that it ends, otherwise it is a fantastically immersive and aweinspiring peice of work. Puzzles are challenging but not so much that you get frustrated and give up all pretty solveable and progression is steady and rewarding with fantastically rendered enviroments which blew me away, ps take the time to look backwards occasionally you really are in another place.
I am going to play it again but slower next time to soak up more of the ambience.
The best thing they could do with this game is add to it and build on it. It seems like it could be an intro for a much bigger experience.
I loved this - brilliant!

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2018
Over 100 VR titles in my library now but this one jumped to near the top of my favorites list, and is a good one to show off the Vive to newbies once you get through the tutorial and brief forays into the Blu and The Lab (my go-tos for introductions to VR). "Story" is minimal but the atmospherics and feel of it, and the beauty of the puzzles, more than carry the day. I wound up finishing it over two sessions but would advise getting through all of it in one go if you can, to maintain the continuity. Enjoy...

SilverFolfy
2,763 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2018
Simply put: IF YOU ARE A FAN OF VR YOU MUST PLAY THIS GAME! Easily one of the best VR experiences I've ever had. I was hesitant at first because I'm normally not a fan of puzzle-type games (Myst, Obduction, etc.) because in the past I've found them too challenging and I usually just give up once I get stuck at a certain point, but for some reason the puzzles in the game are just right: not too hard, but also not too easy. There are no instructions at the start of the game; part of the fun is figuring out what you need to do. Once you do, though, you realize it's all pretty logical (as are all of the puzzles in the game) and you pick it up pretty easily from there on. The graphics are OUTSTANDING (think: Transformers on steroids) and are very entertaining in and of themselves. If I had to pick a weak point, it would be the story line: even after finishing the game, I'm still not 100% sure of the premise for my being there (You're a scientist working on an experiment of some sort) and there is a story line to go with that, but for me it was rather vague. It doesn't reallly matter, though, since everyhing else more than makes up for it. It's not a particularly long game, and if you're of average-or-better intelligence you'll probably finish it fairly quickly, but nonetheless: Highly recommended!
 
mheller1

The only way I can recommend this game is if it is on sale. I personally picked it up for half price, around 7 bucks and at that price I feel its worth it. While the experience was great, I feel it is too short to be worth 15$. This game took me an hour to beat and thats it. So you weigh that for yourself, is 1hr worth 15 bucks? Perhaps to some, to me no which is why I am happy I got it on sale.

Either way the game is pretty good but there is little replay value. So if you see this on sale, pick it up.
 
GhostOokami

Okay, I've never left a review for any game before. Period. A short but amazing trip. The graphics and sound are extremely immersive - to the point where I could SWEAR one of the floating cubes touched my shoulder.
I found the game extremely eye straining, but your mileage may vary.
The puzzles aren't hard, it's easily doable within 1.5 to 2 hours, but the trip is sure worth the time.
About the price though... Well, if possible, get it while it is on sale.

wh1t3c0d3r
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2018
(My first beginning-to-end, made-for-VR experience after a few hours with Steam VR, The Lab etc.)

A stormy night outside.
First darkness of winter creeping in.
VR Room not ready yet, but a decent standing space available for a standing-space focused adventure.
Shiny new Vive. Beast rig in beast mode; hungry for maths.
Everyone else in bed.

(Obviously, a virginal dip into 3D porn is considered...
But my mood is a philosophical mixture of innocent excitement and wanderlust).

So I grab FORM and get zen.

Couldn't have enjoyed it more.
Shortlived compared to a typical game, yes, but then, so is a plate of ebi katsu.
Like the latter, some things are for moments.
FORM is for a moment.
FORM is delicious.
Don't go mad with expectations for the absolutely best moment of your life, but expect to consume some lovingly-crafted high-quality interactive digital art; get zen; get satisfaction; and move on to the next dish.

Between The Lab, FORM and GORN, my thin-but-pernicious insecurity about how wise I've been investing in 'Generation One' of VR has pretty much been eradicated.

Gameplay tip: approach with a childish sense of wonder and curiosity and zen dithering. If you think that - if someone is watching - you'll get shouted at for "mincing about" then I reckon you're on the right path.
 
DJ
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2018
Not much of a story, but it's enough to tie the puzzles together. The puzzles themselves are a bit on the easy side, but a lot of fun to play with and very well animated.

There's a bit of repetition -- you typically repeat one puzzle type three or four times with increasing complexity each time, but they never outstay their welcome and there's enough variation overall to keep things interesting throughout.

Like another reviewer I'm somewhat reminded of The Room. The puzzles here are much simpler but they evoke a similar kind of tactile and visual wonder -- and of course being in VR brings things to a whole new level.
 
Miral
871 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2018
Eines der Spiele, die VR sehr gut umsetzen. Alles wird direkt angefasst oder mit Werkzeugen bedient und Statusänderungen werden direkt am Körpermodel angezeigt.
Die Story und die Puzzel greifen gut in einander und fesseln den Spieler von Anfang bis Ende.
Zudem gibt es noch eine kleine Schnitzeljagd.
Es ist tatsächlich eines der Spiele, an das ich mich auch noch nach mehreren Monaten erinnern kann.
Das Spiel mag zwar relativ kurz sein (je nachdem wie lange man für ein Rätsel benötigt und die Umgebungen erforscht), aber der Preis ist für diese Qualität absolut angemessen.
Ich kann es nur empfehlen.

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2018
Pretty short, straightforward puzzles. Don't buy it at full price, but on sale it's a pretty cool little experience.

THAT BEING SAID:
If you have a problem with heights or claustrophobia, I would not recommend. The game is very pretty, but cold and imposing in an almost scary way, with cavernous abysses and a vague sense of dread. In one part you're in a narrow elevator that fills up right over your head with objects - I had to close my eyes just so I didn't rip the headset off, and was shaking from the discomfort.

Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2018
It's a really beautiful otherworldly puzzle game with soundscape to match the intricate graphics. Highly immersive 3D experience.

This is a great title to show your friends. The puzzles are completely logical and without instruction, you quickly figure out what does what and goes where.

Only issue... it's all over in under an hour. I'm happy I bought it, but was fanging for more when it ended!!! The only puzzle title I can see myself revisiting a second time in the future to do over again.

Évaluation publiée le 6 septembre 2018
Beautiful game. VR shines in sci-fi environments where the world doesn't look the world on earth. This allows for great visuals that are not hampered by "real world" objects that don't look real. The puzzles are simple but are paid off by great visual effects. I played it again just to experience the sound, light and graphics. I know it's short but it's a great experience.

Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2018
Overall
89/100
Game length (Story to 100% Achievement)
0.75 - 4 hours
Gameplay
9/10
Graphics
10/10
Story
7/10
Notes
If you like puzzle games I really recommend this one. It has interesting puzzles and is so beautiful. This is the kind of game I want to play VR for. Unfortunately it is a bit shorter than I wanted. A full length version of a game like this would be quite addicting to get done in one or two sittings/standings. If you are looking to get achievements they are fairly easy. Most are play through the game achievements.

1,140 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2018
Futuristisches Puzzlespiel. Grafik und Beleuchtung ist wunderbar umbesetzt. Auch der Sound ist sehr stimmungsvoll. Die Bedienung der Elemente durch die Bewegungscontroller ist sehr gut gelungen und trägt viel zur Immersion bei. Bei der Story hätte mehr Klarheit nicht geschadet, wobei das Mystische auch OK geht. Schließlich geht es ja um die Puzzle, die immer fair, wenn auch zu einfach sind. Der große Kritikpunkt ist der Spielumfang. Mit 1,4 Stunden für knappe 15 Euro ist das Erlebnis zu schnell beendet. Da die Stimmung, Optik und Soundkulisse teils beeindruckend sind bekommt das Spiel von mir trotz der Kürze den Daumen nach oben.

Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2018
FORM has some amazing alien landscapes to take in, but everything else is painfully mediocre. The puzzles were often insultingly easy despite being constantly reminded what a genius my character is via cringeworthy dialogue bits. I never felt much sense of coherency in the puzzles, they just felt randomly slopped together, not a single "aha!" moment or cathartic relief after a particularly clever solution. Worse yet, the whole thing just sorta ends. Not recommended.

3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2018
Extremely well done. The modelling is fantastic. Atmosphere is absorbing. Sound is great.

Supposed to be standing but I think you could play sitting (facing away from your keyboard).

Massive value for money (and I haven't even finished it yet).

A great one for the library to show your friends and family what VR can be like.

Puzzles aren't mega hard but there were many occasions where I deliberately didn't move on because I was examining the abstract 3 dimensional space around me.

Great job guys... Absolutely love it. Recommend to all who are look for something other than a zombie shoot,
 
splinterz23
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2018
What You Get: About half an hour of some very cool looking animations and decent puzzles.

Pros: When friends come over to demo VR, this is hands down the first puzzle game I will recommend to them. It's straightforward, it's immersive, and it looks amazing. The storytelling is pretty cool, too.

♥♥♥♥: For a single player experience, it's pretty short for the price, even half off. The game play is also entirely linear - I personally prefer games with more open story lines.

Overall: If you are going to share this experience with others, I think it's well worth the price. If you're the only one who will play this, the price tag is likely a bit steep for the content, unless you absolutely love puzzle games.

Will hope to see included expansion in the future.

Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2018
Механика взаимодействия с объектами, графика, сам вид уровней - все на отлично. Сама игра это множество различных головоломок, причем надоесть они не успевают.
В игре нет передвижения - несолько раз за игру, когда нужно переместиться, игрока телепортируют.
Из минусов только длительность - около часа.
Итого отличная игра на час. Отлично зайдет для того чтоб показать VR кому-то из друзей.

Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2018
Sí te gustan los puzzles y comerte el coco, este es tu juego:

Pros:
-Estética futurista muy lograda, incluso te crea inquietud al ver esas formas geométricas tan extrañas.
-Jugado ♥♥♥ unas Samsung odissey, en Windows mixed va perfecto, ni pérdidas de tracking ni errores de ningún tipo.
-Puzzles muy originales, te quedas en algunos diciendo......y ahora como sigo.

Contras:
- No está en español, ni subtitulado, aunque realmente solo tiene diálogos en el inicio, en el resto del juego, es irrelevante el idioma.
- Escasa duración, es buen juego pero corto, en una hora quince, hora treinta te lo acabas. Lo compré de oferta por 7,5€ no pagaría más de 10€ por el.
- No es muy rejugable, una vez conoces los puzzles ya está.

Conclusiones: Divertido y entretenido si te van los puzzles, pero corto, recomiendo comprarlo de oferta.
 
YADER-JRS
0

What else is there to say: a perfect VR game with puzzles. I would like to see much more in VR.

Loki
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2018
FORM is one of the best puzzle games I've played in VR. Its visuals are top notch and the geneal presentation and atmosphere are amazing. The game gives almost zero instructions and instead uses sounds and visuals to let the player know what to do. This is great as you really feel accomplished when you solve the parts of puzzles, though this did lead to a couple times when I stood there in my room trying over and over and over until I just got lucky. At least when that happened, I was able to figure out what I was missing and could solve the rest of the puzzle on my own.

If you like puzzles and have VR, please get this amazing game. I look forward to all future titles by these developers.

очень круто. если кто думает о чем это и что это - The Room в мире ВР. Со временем ОХ эффект сходит на нет и больше придираешься к проектам, здесь этого делать не хочется, хочется просто еще, часов на 5 хотя бы. Однозначно рекомендую.

MrNeoGeo
266 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2018
What a beautiful journey this game was.

Sadly, it is pretty short (I completed the puzzles in one hour) and I hope to see a somehow bigger, more complete version of this game in the future. However, it does not only have one of the best game designs I have ever seen, but also it showcases awesome puzzles that will make your mind blow in many ways.

First of all, FORM is an art masterpiece. Everything you see once you finish the starting zone is astonishingly beautiful. I love abstract concepts, from Quantum Mechanics to impossible shapes, and this game made me speechless with its sheer design and beautifulness. Everything is represented by geometrical constructs that will bend in front of you in ways you had never imagined, breaking your classical concept of reality.

Sound is also pretty amazing. I found myself having eargasms in many moments of this game (especially on the chord tuning puzzle, completing each iteration gave me pure goosebumps in a positive way). Also, this game SHOULD be played with earphones/Deluxe Audio Strap to maximize its immersion factor. The atmosphere and the sound effects will transport you inside this abstract reality like no other game.

Gameplay wise, and as I said before, it is one of the best VR puzzle games out there. Its puzzles reminded me of those found on FRACT OSC: Very abstract components that will not make much sense by themselves, but combined with other ones their purpose gets revealed. Their apparent simplicity will fade out as you unfold polygons and rearrange complex metal structures in order to solve small riddles that will sum parts of a much bigger puzzle. This, combined with a simple yet deep argument makes FORM one of those VR experiences that should be played.

FORM left me wanting more. I really hope Charm Games create a bigger, more advanced version of this surreal, yet beautiful and challenging universe. I totally recommend this game! However, it might be expensive for its current amount of content (15€ for a 1h experience is a bit overpricey, even it being as awesome as FORM is), so I also recommend getting it on a sale!
 
ΒLΛCKΗILL

gl237man
358 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2018
Le f. is this?
This is an abstract puzzler of sorts. Supposed to represent a contact with an alien artifact, and a journey of mind, I suppose.

Well, does it?
It tries, but it does a very crappy job of it.

Why?
The puzzles are only engaging because they're very easy and you literally can't get stuck at them. The writing is too cliched and isn't fun or interesting at all. Also, I believe, the story doesn't arrive to any kind of resolution whatsoever.
At the end of my game a humanoid figure appeared and said that I, the smart scientist, can't really comprehend the mystery of the mysterious alien obelisk, despite me sucessfully solving those primary school puzzles for an hour. Then the end credits rolled. Yay for the triumph of scientific method over mysteries of life, huh.

Is it all bad?
Welp, pretty much. Everybody praises the visuals, but they didn't impress me at all. The locations weren't interesting, the mechanism design was too eagerly trying to seem alien instead of genuinely feeling like something alien, and it didn't use VR's immersion to achieve anything interesting whatsoever. I wouldn't say it's BAD bad, though, but it's really, really bland and boring.

Gimme an example!
Ok. Throughout the game you can pick up globes with letters that are supposed to visualize your, a genious scientist's, thoughts. They're not much more scientific than 'Where am I? What is this?'.

How about you shut up and stop this blasphemy?
Ok. Bottom line - go play I Expect You to Die for cool easy VR puzzles. Go play The Room for cute easy non-VR puzzles. Don't waste money on this. If you get it for free and get stuck in a world with no other entertainment whatsoever, well. Maybe give it a shot then, but keep in mind that it's not worth it.
 
fiftydwarves

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2017
优点：场景设计用心；音乐很棒，氛围很到位；谜题设计自然，难度适中；VR体感极佳。
缺点：谜题套路单一，人与场景互动不足；流程太短，初见一小时即可通关，让人意犹未尽，而且也让故事显得没有头尾。

总体推荐，不过不推荐原价入手，建议等打折。
极其期待他们的下一部作品。
