4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2018
Oh my god, you ♥♥♥♥-tease. This has been the greatest vr experience I've had since I've gotten the vive - but the game ended WAY too quickly.

The puzzles are highly intuitive and audio and visual cues give very helpful hints. There were no puzzles that were over-the-head difficult - everything is laid out in front of you. But I definitely needed more.

The graphics were immersive and very detailed. I felt as though I was pulled into the world of "Interstellar".

Worth the cash, but way too short.

Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2018
Love the atmosphere, it's a lot of fun to play. It would make an excellent VR demo.

It's a short game. I took my time with it. I was expecting the game to open-up near the end with what looked like a hundred more puzzles to solve but it just ended confusingly.

The tasks were easy to understand and were signposted well; the game mechanics were near faultkess in the version I tried.

Keep an eye on Charm Games, this is a really promising VR games developer!

Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2018
Yes, short, but as someone else said, it doesn't overstay its welcome. As a sale item for less than $10, I was actually quite satisfied when I saw the credits. A compact experience that provides about two twilight zone episodes of content. I think the kind of puzzle solving and linear story-telling would have gone stale for me if it had gone on much longer, so I think the brevity actually worked for me. Definitely recommended at the price I paid, and I'd happily buy a sequel.

pseudo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2017
Well if this game doesnt make it obvious that we are going to be all in a Matrix state in the next 20 years then nothing will. Its nothing short of astounding. If you can walk around and bend down and look over the sets you will be amazed. This took a lot of creativity to come up with. It is like HR Geiger artwork mixed with MC Escher set to an amazing soundtrack. There were a couple of times when the thing that was supposed to be there was not or had moved around behind something and gotten hidden in the intricate sets but other than that it works like a charm. I'd play it again just to go through the trippy visuals again. Makes you wonder what the future will bring. Whats funny is if this game came out 10 years ago everyone would be freaking but now its like eh. Totally worth getting worth the experiece. I almost never take time to review games but man this one was so good I got to give the developers some credit. Its amazing what these small teams an do nowadays.

Its a relatively short game which I like. Takes a little less than two hours my first time but if I had to play through again it would probably take about an hour. Short but sweet and worth it just for the visuals which are amazing.

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2017
FORM - это лучшее, что мне доводилось видеть в VR. Имел до этого опыт игры в прочие игры, преимущественно шутеры и могу с определенной уверенностью сказать, что большинство игр в виртуальной реальности (и не только игр) намного позади FORM. Разработчикам удалось найти отличные решения для эргономики, создать прекрасный сценарий, добиться картинки прекрасного качества - чего не хватает другим.
Все эти достижения для современного VR - очень большое событие в пути развития технологии.

Goodman
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2017
A short but very polished example of Monolith Punk.

In this game, you stand in one beautiful place and solve puzzles. The puzzles are interesting, but what really sells this game is the high quality of the video and the audio. The design of the levels and machinery is really interesting, and the sounds are perfect and blend in well with the rest of the presentation.

Story is limited, in other words, story doesn't get in the way of solving puzzles or act as filler to pad out game length.

Game took me 1.4 hours to complete, and I'm a dummy.

Fantastic little game. The real treat is that FORM seems to heavily understand the coolest thing about VR is how you can create scale in a way that no other medium can replicate. FORM makes things BIG, and though the game is criminally short, I can still reccomend it with no reservation, especially if you can find it on ANY sale.

The sound designer should also be properly praised, this game has fantastic use of sound and music, and it really wraps up the experience in making the player feel powerful.

If you got a VR headset and like puzzle games, you canot go wrong with FORM.

Lurkz
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2017
我一直期待The Room这个系列可以做成VR游戏，因为怎么想它的操作系统和解谜方式都非常适合VR。
而Form这个游戏就和The Room非常像了，尤其是前面那个可以旋转的正方体上的解谜，就非常The Room。

说回Form这个游戏，优点很明显，场景非常酷炫，并且剧情（虽然不明所以）也很有趣。而且有些场景做得真是，我一边玩一边产生了，“我是不是要打开真理之门了”和“我薛帕德要和收割者融合成为银河系之神了”的感觉。

而且解谜难度适中，（在硬核解谜玩家眼力应该算是难度太低）对于VR的体验来说这种解谜很合适，如果太难反而会影响VR体验，而且很累。一个小时的体验就非常合理了，希望可以出后续作品。

 
Hang-in-there
1,486 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2017
A rather neat puzzle adventure, very pretty and great atmosphere. I enjoyed the puzzles, some more than others.
I would not call it particularly challenging, and I did like that it was usually easy to determine what you needed to do, even though it would take some time to figure out exactly how (unlike some puzzles in other games where there is not really an indication of even what the puzzle is).
It's only a 1.5-2 hrs game, though after beating it, waiting a while then returning to it would probably be good.

I did get one possible bug with a puzzle where I was pretty sure I was doing it right but nothing was happening. I gave up and tried again the next day and got past that part right away.
 
morderkaine
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2017
This game has truely great spatial graphics and an ambient soundtrack. I was originally caught by the Quabalistic referencing and this is something that certainly could be expanded upon. At times I almost got a sense that I could be being taught about some of its forms, associations and pathways. This would be an amazing addition for those that held such an interest without interfering with the basic gameplay for those that weren't. I was a little disappointed with its overall length and the 'unrepeatability' of play, but for the discounted money and basic VR experience it is certainly a game worth getting.

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2017
WOW... just WOW! This, Ladies and Gentlemen, is the very essence of VR. THIS is what VR should be like. The graphics, the effects, the audio and the story - absolutly gorgeous! Chapeau! I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a brainy entertaining and outerworldly experience.

That said, here comes the "but" to all the above: IT. IS. TOO. SHORT. And while it might seem unfair me ranting over the shortness of VR titles with regards to this marvellous work, there is something basically wrong with the road developers take in VR. I know, I know. It costs a lot of time and money to produce a AAA title with native VR support and the market is still small and whatnot. But y'all have to start somewhere. This title has the potential to be the AAA title users wait for. But under two hours playtime? Been there, done that. I started reacting to this akward premature de-gamjulation within VR Titles by simply refunding them. And while this - I know - is the absolute WRONG way, as I am withdrawing money from people that need it, if they want to create titles that are longer than the average attentionspan of a congolese-red-butt-macaque, I am tired of paying up for too short or too crappy titles (this one is just short and brilliant!). Offer something more, and I would pay double and triple including unconditional loyalty and heartfelt love. I will be watching the creators of this title closely and if and when we apporach a reasonably amout of playtime, I'll be throwing money at them with both hands!

1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2017
tldr: Amazing game visually and fantastic music, maybe not worth $15

What an experience. It only takes around an hour to beat the main game, but that hour sees you through unique puzzles, stunning visuals, and immersive audio the entire time. This is the kind of game you show off to people when they want to try VR out. The interactive music thing is also fun, even if the controls aren't super clear.

I see only 2 downsides to this game, the price and the superfluous story. It didn't really add, well, anything.

On sale, this game is absolutely worth it

Die Transformationen der futuristischen Artefakte und die Lichteffekte sind wunderschön anzusehen und die Puzzles nicht zu schwer. Diesen Titel habe ich in einem Zug mit Freude durchgespielt. Die kurze Spielzeit ist aufgrund der Arbeit, die in diesem Titel steckt und die man ihr auch ansieht, in Ordnung. Man muss gleichzeitig positiv erwähnen, dass auf künstliche Längen verzichtet wurde. Meine Anfälligkeit für Motion-Sickness spielte hier keine Rolle, da auf künstliche Bewegungen verzichtet wird. Ich halte dieses Spiel als hervorragend geeignet, um auch VR-Anfänger zu begeistern.

Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2017
There are a few reviews that point out FORM's similarity to The Room, and that's fair. However, the beautiful graphics and atmosphere, and the innate tactility of the interactions, raise this gem to a must-have VR title. It's just beautiful to take part in this game. It has been extremely lovingly crafted, and is the sort of experience you'll play over and over just toenjoythe wonderful interactions, long after you've solved all of its deft and satisfying puzzles. Has all the cool of the puzzle box in Hellraiser, without any of the gory consequences.

This has become one my go-to titles to show people what VR is all about.

Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2017
This is a great, polished, enjoyable 45-minute to an hour experience. The animations in particular are AMAZING, on the level of Valve's "The Lab". The puzzles themselves are simple, the story is light but appropriate for the setting.

I do wish it cost $10 instead of $15 given the relatively short length, but with production values this high I'm fine with what I paid. I'll run some friends through this one too - a great "here's what storytelling in VR can do that flat screens can't" game.

AtomicPunk
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2017
This is a great VR experience. Except for a couple of on rails teleportation sequences, It's entirely stand-in-place, so it doesn't require much physical play space and avoids issues with locomotion. Gameplay involves a lot of touch interaction with geometry and physical contraption puzzles which is pretty basic as far as puzzlers go, but novel and well implemented in VR. The plot is enigmatic, and short. The game seems like it's structured for a 3rd act, but ends abruptly which is a disappointment. However, there are some genuinely delight and awe inspiring moments supported by great sound design and visually intriguing environments. I think we're going to reach a point in the evolution of VR gameplay where simple manipulation mechanics start to feel like an adult version of a toddler's block slot toy, but at this point in the arc, just having things to look at and do in VR is entertaining, and FORM is a worthwhile environment to spend some time in. Props to the developer for being responsive. I reported a crash bug (turned out I had an old build), and got a personal reply within hours.
 
improbability

1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2017
I'm a VR snob. If a game doesn't have well polished mechanics, visuals, and sound, forget it.

This has the mechanics. It has the visuals. It has the sound. What it doesn't have too much of, however, is difficulty. All of the puzzles are really easy to solve. Like many well polished VR games, it only has an hour or two of content.

Regardless, it was really enjoyable and I fully recommend it at the price I paid (it was on sale).

One of the most well polished VR experiences I've tried!

Enjoyable VR puzzle game with a good narrative and excellent graphics, very polished - puzzles are each a reasonable length and not particularly challenging. Archuen
248 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2017
WOW!

(Incoming unabashed gushing)

There were so many moments during my playthrough of FORM where I stopped and stared in absolute awe of the stunning visuals. This type of game is the reason I got the Vive. The gameplay is intuitive and engaging, and progressing through each section instilled a feeling of feverish enlightenment. The puzzles themselves didn't feel overly complex, but were still satisfying to complete. The interaction with the puzzles, and the interactions it had with the environment was spectacular!

Unfortunately in my haste to unfold the story, the magic ended all too soon, which leads me to my one grievance: I wanted more! FORM is like a good book: I simply could not put it down.

I would love to see a continuation of this title (episodic?), with more content, harder puzzles, and the same detailed excellence the devs put into this title.

Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2017
Prety solid VR experience here. It's more visually WOW than gameplay wow. The puzzles are unique and not many mechanics are reused throughout the hour or so of gameplay. There are some really cool shaders used in the game and everything looks nice and crisp, if not a little dark at times. The complex-transformer-like animations on the objects and environment pieces are the best part about this game! The story could be improved, but overall it's worth checking out if you like puzzle games.

Hallo,
Ein wirklich sehr schönes Spiel.
Ich wollte nur einmal kurz reinschauen und hab es doch durchgespielt.
Gut, in einer Stunde war ich durch. Aber diese aufwendigen Animationen
sind einfach klasse. Die Rätsel sind gut zu meistern. An keiner Stelle

anderen Welt. Die Programmierer hätten den Schwierigkeitsgrad sicher bei einigen Rätseln
erhöhen können, um so die Spielzeit zu verlängern. Schön das sie es nicht

Blackmave
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2017
This is a game that's reminiscent of escape the room type puzzle games. It's not a particularly long game, it takes around an hour to an hour and a half to finish. The puzzles are on the easy side as well, but not so easy that you'll be bored with them.

What really sets this game apart (and justifies the price point vs. length) is the aesthetic of the game. It takes you into a world that you'll never find in real life, and allows you to experience it through the magic of VR. It's a mix of the strange and the futuristic, and it makes you feel like you're in another world while you're solving these puzzles. If you want to experience one of the more mind blowing environments in VR, check out this game. My only complaint is that there isn't more.
 
Lynx
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2017
This is a wonderful little experience. I definitely felt like I had been whisked away to an alternate dimension. It's fairly short at only about an hour but I thought this was the right length for this style of game and with the 40% discount, which brought it down to about $10, I thought it was well worth the price. This is definitely something I will show to friends who are new to VR so they can see its potential for interactive storytelling. I'm sure I will return to this fantastic title at a later date when I have a much higher resolution headset than the Vive so I can full appreciate its beauty.

Thank you very much to the developers at Charm Games for allowing me the opportunity to step into your imaginations and I look forward to whatever you produce next.

yehahorsey
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2017
I wasn’t sure what to expect from this game. I know it was a puzzle game, and so far, am impressed with it. If you ever have played ‘The Room’ series, it feels a lot like that. For VR, this type of gameplay where you need to grab onto things to solve the puzzle is what VR is all about. I had some connection hiccups when trying to grab objects at a certain level, but that is due to how my sensors are setup and not the game itself.

Gameplay: So far I’ve just scratched the surface of the game, but I find, just like a movie or novel, if it doesn’t grab your attention within the first few chapters or minutes generally the outcome is bleak.

The overall concept is beautiful and I look forward to play this more in the upcoming days.
Price point is spot on. Purchased it when it was on sale, but even at full price the game is worth it.

If you like puzzles and enjoyed ‘The Room’ series you should enjoy this game.
 
Grizzley1978

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2017
"Wow!" I couldn't stop saying that while playing through this game. I have played many VR titles but none have pulled me in like this one. I don't review a lot of games but this one earned it!

The puzzles are simple but require you to think outside the box. While the game is on the shorter side this is an experience that really shows what VR is all about. You could not get this kind of experience anywhere else. If you own a VR headset you owe it to yourself to play this game. Well worth the price!

Update: Had to go back and 100% this game. All but 2 of the achievements are story related. Check the games discussion page for hints on the last 2!

0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2017
I bought this one when it was 40% off a 21.99 price, and I'm not sure I got my full money's worth even at that due to how short this game is.

That said, I really liked every minute of play time and I'm leaving a positive review because I would like to see more games like this and more from this developer. I'm not in to super hyper action VR sessions, and much prefer atmospheric sensory experiences and this game certainly delivers.

I would classify this more as a demo or a proof of concept for a full game. Pay whatever you feel is worth it for about an hour of very enjoyable play time.
 
ub
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2017
FORM is great VR in any respect. Sound, colors, geometry and the feel to VR is one of the best experiences there is. The game itself is not unlike the "The Room" games. You solve similar to "The Room" puzzles using spacial sense in a VR environment.

The only drawback is the very, VERY limited playtime. Even if you don't rush and look at the beautiful scenery this game does not take any longer than about 1 hour. 1 hour now is great entertainment, but for 19,99 Euros this is too expensive! The mentioned game "The Room" for example gives you a 3 hour gameplay with similar entertainment for only 4,99 Euros. It's not VR, but the puzzles in game are very similar.

So it's hard for me to recommend this game for the original price. It's also hard for me, to not recommend it, since it is VR at it's best. I got it for a discount -40%. It's still 11,99 Euros which I still find quite expensive for a 1 hour game.

All things considered, I can recommend this game, IF you can manage a discount on it. Do not(!) buy it for the regular price, because I find it not worth 19,99 Euros for 1 hour PC gaming entertainment.
 
Friedrich Nix

1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2017
A solid 8/10 for me. I *definitely* wouldn't mind if the conclusion felt more... conclusion-y, but I knew about the game's length, and bought it anyways- and it was *totally* worth it.

The visuals in this game are nothing short of breathtaking (*really* captures that 'first human trapped in an alien puzzle cube' feel!), and the puzzles are among the most fun I've played with in VR yet.

Some may balk at the price per hour of gameplay being offered here, but I'm telling you- this game is a like a fancy, high end firework show- it burns hard and fast, but every moment is unique in a way I haven't seen done in any other VR experience I've tried (and I've tried a *lot*)

Sehr immersiv

The Bad:
Rätsel zu einfach

Empfehlung: unbedingt kaufen wenn Preis unter 10 Euro.

SomA
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2017
I did not expect a long game but it ended when I thought I had completed half of it. In addition the ending/outro could've been just a little bit longer with more things going on, as it is now it felt a bit lame compared to the actual game.

The puzzles are quite simple but not bad. They often occur in different variations, but they only became longer rather than more difficult. IMHO this game is more about experiencing awesome alien locations, and the puzzles only exist to give you something to do with your hands while watching everything around you.

At least one puzzle requires being able to tell different colors apart (red, orange, green and blue) so it could be difficult for color blind people. There was also one puzzle which required me to reach quite far above my head (I'm 186cm) and someone significanly shorter might have trouble completing it.

With all that having been said I still recommend this game, especially if you're able to get it on a sale, as long as you don't expect a long game or challenging puzzles.
 
[🐱]Superking

Évaluation publiée le 7 juin 2017
This is truly a hidden gem! :)

While it's a rather short experience (took me only 34 minutes), it can be played in one sitting ("standing") and the atmosphere is amazing. Reminds me of the ending of "The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed" and it plays like a VR version of "The Room" - both are very good things.

Maybe it will get expanded if it sells well? But even if you only play through it once, that experience is worth it, and it'll be a great way to demo VR to others as well.

Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
Wow! Vielleicht das beste Puzzle-Spiel bisher in VR und wenn doch nicht das beste, dann doch garantiert das schönste.

Die Rätsel sind nicht sonderlich schwer aber wie sie umgesetzt sind ist einfach wunderschön. Das Spiel ist mit etwa 1 bis 1,5 Stunden zwar kurz aber dafür ist auch jede Minute definitiv ihr Geld wert.

Meiner Ansicht nach ein Pflichtkauf für diejenigen die Qualität über Quantität setzen (ich würde sagen vom "Wow-Faktor" her hat man das Gefühl, man spielt hier über 1 Stunde lang das Ende von "The Gallery: Call Of The Starseed").

Unterstützt die guten Entwickler! Qualität hat seinen Preis!

Punkte 9,5/10
 
ManOrAstroman?
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juin 2017
FORM does a thing I've only seen partially achieved by artist Isaac Cohen in his VR experiments (LUNE and Blarp! and My 'lil Donut) and that's create objects that cannot possibly exist in our reality and gives them a form.

Beautifully crafted puzzles that are fairly simple to get through if you apply some logic, but leave you filled with wonderment at the shapes materialising before you.

It's very easy to become disassociated with space when you're standing on an infinitely high column above an infinitely high abyss while an even more infinitely large pyramid burns with fire in front of you. The sense of presence is wonderful as the sound design is for the most part good too, despite some... stilted voice acting - but don't get me wrong - the fact that they went to the trouble to record lines for a game in such a small market as VR shows they're willing to put the effort in to make a game as good as it can be and not just half-ass measures.

Though could possibly do with a hard mode next devs... ;)

Innovative and beautiful, with plenty of varied scene changes and different interactions to figure out the puzzles with. A very good buy for the price.
 
Riddla
0
